Les participants font part d'expériences et acquièrent une meilleure compréhension de l'approche axée sur le cycle électoral, ce qui renforce ainsi la capacité d'élaborer et de mettre en oeuvre de futures initiatives d'assistance électorale. Le projet s'inscrit dans le cadre du Programme multilatéral d'observation électorale, lequel emprunte une approche pangouvernementale pour fournir du soutien canadien aux missions multilatérales d'observation électorale dans les pays en développement. Son principal objectif est d'aider les pays en développement à tenir des élections démocratiques conforment aux normes électorales nationales et internationales. L'appui à l'observation électorale permet de renforcer le processus électoral dans les pays en développement.

project_title: Support to the 2009 Afghan Elections / Appui aux élections Afghanes de 2009
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE 2009 AFGHAN ELECTIONS / APPUI AUX ÉLECTIONS AFGHANES DE 2009
long_description: The Election Support Team (EST) to Afghanistan of the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) assists Afghan government and international efforts for the 2009 presidential and provincial council elections. Specifically, the OSCE EST will focus on the following issues: capacity building/sustainability, domestic observation, voter registration and the results process. / L'Équipe d'appui aux élections (ÉAÉ) afghanes de l'Organisation pour la sécurité et la co-operation en Europe (OSCE) appui les efforts du gouvernement afghan et de la communauté internationale dans le cadre des élections présidentielles et provinciales de 2009. Specifiquement, l'ÉAÉ se concentrera sur les sujets suivants: le développement des capaciés / durabilité, l'observation nationale, l'inscription des électeurs et le processus menant aux résultats finaux.

project_title: To chart the progress and integrity of the democratic/electoral process by examining the voter registration issues Indonesia continues to face
short_description: TO CHART THE PROGRESS AND INTEGRITY OF THE DEMOCRATIC/ELECTORAL PROCESS BY EXAMINING THE VOTER REGISTRATION ISSUES INDONESIA CONTINUES TO FACE
long_description: To chart the progress and integrity of the democratic/electoral process by examining the voter registration issues Indonesia continues to face and minimising election irregularities and election related human rights violations in central Java and Jakarta

project_title: Central Governance Transition Project / Projet transitionnel en gouvernance centrale
short_description: CENTRAL GOVERNANCE TRANSITION PROJECT / PROJET TRANSITIONNEL EN GOUVERNANCE CENTRALE
long_description: This project is a follow up phase to the successful Central Governance project which ended in June 2008. The goal of this one year transition project is to continue to enhance the Government of Ghana's policy management process. The project will strengthen the foundations of Ghana's executive decision-making system through the application of products, procedures and processes developed in the previous phase of the Central Governance project. It will also build the capacity of the Ghanaian management to implement reforms. The Government of Ghana asked CIDA to assist with the development of its executive decision-making system, which is a central element of its overall public sector reforms. The project, by June 2009, made substantial progress in continuing to strengthen policy management processes of the Government of Ghana begun under the Central Governance Reform Project. The current project has contributed to the increased knowledge and application of skills of policy development and decision-making requirements of staff in key central Ministries and Departments (including Ministries of Finance and Economic Planning, Food and Agriculture, Local Government and Rural Development, Health, Education and Women and Children's Affairs) as well as the Office of the President. The use of standard formats and tracking of Cabinet documents has continued successfully, demonstrating integration and usefulness of the new processes into the Government's practices. The transition from one government to another following the December 2008 elections has gone well; handover notes prepared by each Ministry and Department by outgoing Ministers for those incoming made an important contribution to a smooth transition. / Ce projet fait suite au projet de Réformes de la gouvernance au niveau du gouvernement central, projet qui a pris fin en juin 2008. L'objectif du projet est de continuer à améliorer le processus de gestion des politiques du gouvernement du Ghana. Le projet permettra le renforcement des bases du processus de prise de décisions au niveau exécutif en faisant appel à des produits, des processus et des procédures élaborés dans le cadre du Projet pour la gouvernance centrale au Ghana. Il renforcera également les capacités de gestion nécessaires à la mise en oeuvre des réformes. Le Gouvernememt du Ghana a demandé à l'ACDI de l'aider à développer son processus de prise de décisions au niveau exécutif, ce qui correspond à un des volets des réformes prévues dans l'ensemble du secteur public. En date du juin 2009, le projet a réalisé des progrès substantiels. Il a continué à renforcer les processus de gestion de politiques du gouvernement du Ghana, lancés dans le cadre du projet portant sur les réformes de la gouvernance au niveau du gouvernement central. Grâce au projet, le personnel du Bureau du président ainsi que des principaux ministères et organismes (ministères des Finances et de la Planification économique, de l'Alimentation et de l'Agriculture, de l'Adm

project_title: Strengthening Election Processes / Renforcement du processus électoral
short_description: STRENGTHENING ELECTION PROCESSES / RENFORCEMENT DU PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL
long_description: The project contributes to strengthening democratic electoral procedures and practices in Ukraine through the following components: the establishment and introduction of a unified state voter register, which includes the implementation of a national voter awareness campaign on rights and responsibilities towards the register; assistance in electoral legislation codification; increasing the level of professionalism of election officials; and promoting a wider participation of women and gender awareness during the electoral process. Results as of October 2009: the project assisted the development of a State Voter Register, which was acknowledged during the 2009 Annual Cisco Systems Inc. Conference as the best State-level IT project in Ukraine in the sphere of network technologies. In total, the capacity of 2,208 Regional Monitoring Bodies (RMB) personnel (95% of total RMB personnel) on how to use the State Voter Register system has been improved through the delivery of 51 one-day training sessions. / Le projet contribue à renforcer les politiques et procédures électorales démocratiques en Ukraine. Les composantes du projet sont : l'établissement d'un registre électoral national unifié, incluant la mise en oeuvre d'une campagne nationale de sensibilisation des électeurs sur leurs droits et responsabilités envers le registre; un appui à la codification de la législation électorale; l'amélioration du niveau de professionnalisme des agents électoraux. Le projet fera également la promotion d'une plus grande participation des femmes et d'une sensibilisation sur la question de l'égalité entre les femmes et les hommes pendant le processus électoral. En octobre 2009, les résultats suivants avaient été obtenus : le projet a contribué à la création d'un registre électoral national qui a été salué, lors de l'édition 2009 de la conférence annuelle de Cisco Systems Inc., comme le meilleur projet de technologies de l'information émanant de l'État dans le secteur des technologies de réseau en Ukraine. Au total, 2 208 employés des organismes de surveillance régionaux (soit 95 p. 100 de l'effectif) ont suivi 51 séances de formation d'une journée et ainsi amélioré leur utilisation du registre électoral d'État.

project_title: Civil Society Support Fund / Fonds d'appui à la société civile
short_description: CIVIL SOCIETY SUPPORT FUND / FONDS D'APPUI À LA SOCIÉTÉ CIVILE
long_description: The project finances a decentralized short-term fund that serves to provide responsive support for initiatives that develop and strengthen the participation of women in the 2007 election process. The initiatives funded relate, for the most part, to increasing the number of, and/or supporting, female candidates, increasing the representation of women in election management and monitoring structures and mechanisms, and encouraging the participation of more women voters. The funds provided to the civil-society organizations selected support activities such as: advocacy and lobbying, especially of leaders of major political forces, administrative and traditional authorities, heads of electoral institutions and mechanisms; mobilizing members of civil society, the media, and public opinion; strengthening the abilities and skills of women leaders and candidates, especially in promoting ideas and/or political agendas and election campaign platforms; and strengthening electoral abilities and skills, particularly among women. / Le projet finance un fonds décentralisé à court terme, destiné à soutenir sur une base réactive la mise en oeuvre d'actions de renforcement et de développement de la participation des femmes au processus électoral de 2007. Les initiatives soutenues sont surtout reliées à la multiplication des candidatures féminines et/ou au soutien aux femmes candidates, à l'augmentation du nombre de femmes au sein des structures et mécanismes de gestion et de surveillance des élections et à l'augmentation des femmes électrices. L'appui aux différentes organisations de la société civile qui sont retenues sert à réaliser diverses activités de : plaidoyer et lobbying, notamment auprès des responsables des principales forces politiques, des autorités administratives et traditionnelles, des chefs des institutions et mécanismes électoraux; mobilisation des membres de la société civile, des médias et de l'opinion publique; renforcement des aptitudes et compétences des femmes leaders et candidates, notamment en matière de promotion et défense d'idées et/ou d'agendas politiques et de campagne électorale; renforcement des aptitudes et habiletés électorales, principalement chez les femmes.

project_title: Gender and Governance Programme - UNIFEM
long_description: The Goal of the GGP is: Gender equity and equality in Kenyan improved. Vision: Towards 50:50 Women and Men Governing Together. Purpose: Increased women participation in democratic governance and improved gender responsive systems, structures and institutions for good governance and gender equity. UNIFEM Kenya is the Prog.Fin.Management Agent.  Acitivities includes ways of strengthening women candidates in the run up to the general elections in 2007.

project_title: Electoral Assistance
long_description: 1.   Capacities of CNE/STAE in election planning, budgeting, organisation and management in selected technical areas strengthened2.  New forms and channels of civic and voter education implemented during the whole electoral cycle 2007-2009.

project_title: STRENGTHENING IDN DEM (SIDES)
long_description: The SIDES Project supports in furthering the institutionalisation of democratic elections in Indonesia through the enhancement of quality of the electoral system, the provision of legal framework for an independent electoral management body, and capacity

project_title: Presidential and Legislative Elections 2007 / Élections présidentielles et législatives 2007
short_description: PRESIDENTIAL AND LEGISLATIVE ELECTIONS 2007 / ÉLECTIONS PRÉSIDENTIELLES ET LÉGISLATIVES 2007
long_description: The main objective of the project is to strengthen the democratization process in Mali by holding credible, transparent, fair, and equitable presidential and legislative elections. The purpose of the project is to build the Government of Mali's capacities and means to hold widely participatory, transparent, and credible elections. The project is organized around the following components and activities: contribution to the election support pooled fund established by the Ministry of Territorial Administration and Local Communities (MATCL) to channel partner funds; election training, including training of staff responsible for steering, managing, and controlling the election process, as well as polling station personnel; deployment of steering, management, and control mechanisms; regulated and equitable media coverage; and management and control of security measures. In May 2008, following the peaceful elections of 2007, the Government of Mali initiated discussions to review its electoral process, and in particular to study the possibility of adopting a permanent election management mechanism. The Canadian electoral system is one of the potential models for reform. The project provided support to the Mali electoral process: an electoral master plan was drawn up and implemented; structures for managing and running the elections were established; the electoral card index was updated and voters lists were published; 20,333 polling stations were set up for the presidential election and 18,918 stations for the parliamentary elections, etc. This helped secure credible and transparent presidential and parliamentary elections. The project also contributed to the current debate on reform of the electoral system, opening the door to a permanent voting structure based on the Canadian model. / L'objectif du projet est de contribuer au renforcement du processus de démocratisation au Mali par la tenue d'élections présidentielles et législatives crédibles et transparentes, justes et équitables. Le but du projet est de renforcer les capacités et les moyens du gouvernement malien pour la tenue d'élections largement participatives, transparentes et crédibles. Le projet s'articule autour des composantes et activités suivantes: contribution au fonds commun d'appui aux élections mis en place par le Ministère de l'Administration territoriale et des collectivités locales (MATCL) pour canaliser les fonds des partenaires; formation électorale, comprenant la formation du personnel chargé du pilotage, de la gestion et du contrôle du processus électoral et du personnel des bureaux de vote; déploiement des structures de pilotage et de gestion/contrôle; couverture médiatique réglementé et equitable; gestion et contrôle des mesures de sécurité. En mai 2008, suite aux élections pacifiques de 2007, le gouvernement malien engage une réflexion pour revoir son processus électoral et en particulier étudier la possibilité d'un mécanisme de gestion des élections qui soit permanent. Le mo

project_title: Election Management
long_description: To introduce the election system of South Korea, election management, good examples etc.

project_title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
long_description: Monitoring and Observation of Two By-Elections in Bomachoge and Shinyalu. The project aimed at monitoring and observing two by-elections arising from the 2007 General Elections in Kenya. Monitoring and observation of the by-elections will provide an opportunity to determine the credibility, peacefulness, freeness and fairness of the two by-elections. It will also provide an opprtunity to determine the level of preparedness on the part of the Interim Independent Electoral Commission (IIEC) to deliver on its mandate under the Constitution of Kenya Amendment Act of 2008. In particular it will enable an assessment to be conducted on IIEC's capacity as an institution for electoral change and reforms in Kenya. Through the assessment, weaknesses and gaps in the capacity of the IIEC will be identified which will inform necessary interventions. The project is therefore, aimed at contributing towards stregthening and improving the electoral processes and environment, including electoral administration and management in Kenya.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Friends of Africa International
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO FRIENDS OF AFRICA INTERNATIONAL
long_description: To strengthen and promote peaceful electoral participation in Sudan. FAI will train and mobilize civil society groups, political party and electoral officials at the local and regional levels on electoral transparency and conflict management. FAI will produce 1000 copies of a handbook on early conflict management for participants and election monitors.

project_title: Fair Elections and Institutional Reforms / Élections justes et réformes institutionnelles
short_description: FAIR ELECTIONS AND INSTITUTIONAL REFORMS / ÉLECTIONS JUSTES ET RÉFORMES INSTITUTIONNELLES
long_description: Through this project, CIDA is collaborating with The Asia Foundation, local civil society partner organizations (including the 34-member Election Working Group or EWG), the Bangladesh Election Commission, and other bilateral agencies. The purpose of the project is to strengthen an enabling environment for a free, fair, and non-violent 2008 parliamentary election whose results are accepted by the people of Bangladesh, major political actors, and the international community. Program activities are focused on building domestic monitoring capacity, including the deployment of 165,000 volunteer monitors on Election Day; coordination with international observer missions; voter and civic education on priority thematic issues (prevention of violence, democratic representation and accountability, women's participation, first-time voters, rights of disabled persons; and ethnic and religious minorities); assisting the Bangladesh Election Commission with the voter registration process; and conducting dialogues with the political parties and candidates, police and other law enforcement officials, local government officials, civil society, and citizens on the steps to be taken to ensure a free and fair election. / Par le biais de ce projet, l'ACDI collabore avec la Asia Fondation, des organisations partenaires de la société civile (y compris le Groupe de travail sur les élections composé de 34 membres),la Commission électorale du Bangladesh et d'autres organisations bilatérales. Le but du projet est de créer un environnement plus propice en vue de la tenue d'élections parlementaires libres, justes et pacifiques en 2008 dont les résultats seront acceptés par la population bangladaise, par les principaux acteurs politiques et la communauté internationale. Les activités de programme sont axées sur le renforcement des capacités en matière de surveillance locale, y compris le déploiement de 165000 observateurs électoraux le jour du scrutin; la coordination avec les missions d'observateurs internationaux; l'éducation civique des électeurs au sujet des questions thématiques prioritaires (prévention de la violence, représentation démocratique et responsabilisation, participation des femmes, nouveaux électeurs, droits des personnes handicapées, minorités ethniques et religieuses); le soutien à la Commission électorale relativement au processus d'inscription des électeurs; la tenue de dialogues avec les partis politiques, les candidats, la police et d'autres responsables de l'application de la loi, des hauts fonctionnaires locaux, des membres de la société civile et des citoyens au sujet des mesures à prendre pour garantir la tenue d'élections libres et justes.

project_title: Civil Society and Governance Support / Appui à la gouvernance et à la société civile
short_description: CIVIL SOCIETY AND GOVERNANCE SUPPORT / APPUI À LA GOUVERNANCE ET À LA SOCIÉTÉ CIVILE
long_description: This project is largely oriented around the Canadian International Development Agency's (CIDA) Country Development Programming Framework for Cameroon, which in 2003 outlined good governance and support to civil society as key focus areas. The goal of the project is to support the governance capacities of a select group of government, civil society and private sector institutions in an effort to ensure a responsible, equitable state that respects the rights of its citizens. Areas of support include: judicial administration, management of public funds, the electoral process, democratic development and ensuring basic human rights are upheld in Cameroon. As a result of this project the men and women of Cameroon are expected to be better informed as to their individual rights, to be more involved in their communities and able to actively improve their quality of life. / Ce projet est largement orienté autour du Cadre de programmation-pays 2003 de l'Agence canadienne de développement international (ACDI) pour le Cameroun, qui place la bonne gouvernance et le soutien à la société civile au coeur de ses priorités. L'objectif du projet est d'appuyer les capacités en matière de gouvernance d'un groupe choisi d'organismes publics et privés et de la société civile, en vue d'encourager l'émergence d'un État responsable et équitable respectueux des droits de ses citoyens. Font l'objet d'un appui l'administration judiciaire, la gestion des fonds publics, le processus électoral, le développement démocratique et le respect des droits humains fondamentaux au Cameroun. Grâce à ce projet, les hommes et les femmes de ce pays connaissent mieux leurs droits individuels, s'impliquent davantage dans leur collectivité et sont mieux outillés pour travailler activement à l'amélioration de leur qualité de vie.

project_title: Strengthening Electoral Processes in Zambia / Renforcement des procèssus électoraux en Zambie
short_description: STRENGTHENING ELECTORAL PROCESSES IN ZAMBIA / RENFORCEMENT DES PROCÈSSUS ÉLECTORAUX EN ZAMBIE
long_description: The proposed initiative aims to strengthen citizen engagement, electoral processes, and practices in line with CIDA's objectives in democratization. As a significant donor, CIDA will join the Governance Sector Advisory Group and thereby broaden its scope in governance at the national level. The expected impact of the project will be the enhanced effectiveness of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to conduct transparent and fair elections. More specifically, the project will enhance accuracy of the voter register; increase capacity of the National Voter Education Committee to coordinate, plan and implement continuous voter education; strengthen participation by women as candidates and strengthen organizational capacity of civil sociey organisations working in the area of women's political rights in Zambia; strengthen capacity of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to engage the media; and revise the legislative framework and code of conduct to ensure a viable and fair means of redress in the event of electoral malpractices. / L'initiative proposée vise à consolider l'engagement des citoyens, les processus électoraux et les pratiques, conformément aux objectifs de l'ACDI en matière de démocratisation. À titre d'important donateur, l'ACDI se joindra au groupe consultatif sur la gouvernance et élargira ainsi sa portée en matière de gouvernance à l'échelle nationale. Le projet devrait consolider l'efficacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie, afin que ses élections soient menées de façon transparente et juste. Plus particulièrement, le projet améliorera l'exactitude de l'inscription électorale; renforcera la capacité du comité national d'éducation des électeurs à coordonner, planifier et mettre en place un système d'éducation continue des électeurs; accroîtra la participation des femmes comme candidates aux élections et renforcera la capacité organisationnelle des organisations de la société civile qui oeuvrent pour les droits politiques de la femme en Zambie; renforcera la capacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie à faire participer les médias; révisera le cadre législatif et le code de conduite pour assurer une voie de recours viable et juste en cas de pratiques électorales malhonnêtes.

project_title: SUPPORT TO ELECTORAL REFORMS
long_description: The objectives of this project are to support the reform programme of the Malawi Electoral Commission to become a more effective, responsive accountable and credible electoral management organization in Malawi and to provide support to elections in Malawi

project_title: Election Support Team
long_description: Support of Afghanistan's election process, focal points - capacity building, voter registration, results process

project_title: Elections and Political Processes - Election Management
short_description: ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES - ELECTION MANAGEMENT
long_description: Elections and Political Processes - Support electoral management bodies to conduct elections, formal adjudication of electoral disputes, and security for elections.

project_title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow (ELECT) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ENHANCING LEGAL AND ELECTORAL CAPACITY FOR TOMORROW (ELECT) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The ELECT project strengthens the ability of the Afghan government to conduct free and fair elections through technical support targeting Independent Elections Commission (IEC). Main objectives of the project are ongoing institutional strengthening of the IEC, exploring ways to improve voter registration and focusing on civic and voter education. Assistance to the IEC is provided in the form of Technical Advisors, who are working in partnership with their Afghan counterparts from the IEC. These advisors are not expected to take a lead in electoral administration decision making, but rather provide specialized and targeted support to the various IEC departments heads enhancing their preparations for the future round of elections. In partnership with other donor countries, USAID support to the IEC through the UNDP ELECT basket fund will help Afghan government deliver free, fair and credible elections with results that are broadly accepted by majority of Afghan people.

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Elections Canada and Responsive Fund Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Volet Élections Canada et fonds réactif
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes taking place between 2009 and 2011. It includes technical and material support to the Provisional Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project includes activities implemented by Haitian civil society organizations, technical support by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes, and the establishment of a responsive fund.   CIDA is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - UNDP Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total. / L'objectif du projet d'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux qui ont lieu entre 2009 et 2011, notamment par l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral provisoire et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet vise la mise en place d'activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile haïtienne, un appui technique fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haïtiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux et la mise en place d'un fonds réactif.   L'ACDI appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Volet PNUD. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Volet Programme des Nations Unies pour le développement (PNUD)
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes taking place between 2009 and 2011. It includes technical and material support to the Provisional Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project is managed by the United Nations Development Program (UNDP), which provides technical and material support to Haitian authorities during electoral processes.   CIDA is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - Elections Canada and Responsive Fund Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total.   Results as of April 2010 include: This component of the project supported the organization of the first and second round of senatorial elections, on April 19 and June 21, 2009, the first since the presidential elections of 2006. It helped issue 9.1 million ballots and procure 12,000 voting kits, and supported the management of the Vote Tabulation Centre. This component also helped to strengthen the operational capacities of the Provisional Electoral Council. / L'objectif du projet d'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux qui ont lieu entre 2009 et 2011, notamment par l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral provisoire et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet est géré par le Programme des Nations-Unies pour le développement (PNUD), qui fournit un appui technique et matériel aux autorités haïtiennes lors des processus électoraux.   L'ACDI appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Volet Élections Canada et fonds réactif. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.   Parmi les résultats obtenus jusqu'en avril 2010 : Ce volet du projet a appuyé l'organisation du premier et du second tour des élections sénatoriales qui ont eu lieu le 19 avril et le 21 juin 2009, les premières depuis les élections présidentielles de 2006. Ce volet du projet a contribué à l'émission de 9,1 millions de bulletins de vote; l'acquisition de 12 000 trousses électoraux et un appui à la gestion du Centre de tabulation des votes. Il a également contribué à renforcer les capacités opérationnelles du Conseil électoral provisoire.

project_title: Canadian Crossroads International - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / Carrefour Canadien International - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
long_description: This volunteer sending program supports 459 volunteer placements which contribute to the development objectives of 30 developing-country organizations in collaboration with 30 Canadian organizations. These placements (or assignments/exchanges) and partnerships strengthen the capacity of partner organizations from developing countries to achieve development results through the sharing of skills and knowledge related to program delivery, organizational management, and engagement in policy dialogue. Canadian Crossroads International (CCI) is focusing on three areas of development, all within a gender equality framework: (1) women's rights through increased political representation and reduced violence against women; (2) poverty reduction through increased access to resources and a stronger social economy; and (3) improved access to preventative care and treatment of HIV/AIDS and reduction of discrimination and stigma associated with this disease.   An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Ce programme d'envoi de volontaires soutient 459 échanges de bénévoles qui contribuent aux objectifs de développement de 30 organisations des pays en développement en collaboration avec 30 organisations canadiennes. Ces stages (ou missions/échanges) et ces partenariats renforcent la capacité des organisations partenaires des pays en développement à atteindre des résultats en développement à travers le partage de compétences et de connaissances qui se rapportent à la gestion de programme, à la gestion organisationnelle, et à la participation au dialogue politique. Carrefour Canadien International (CCI) vise trois secteurs de développement, tous dans le cadre de l'égalité entre les sexes : 1) défendre les droits des femmes en augmentant leur représentation politique et, réduire la violence faite aux femmes; 2) réduire la pauvreté en augmentant l'accès aux ressources et en renforçant l'économie sociale; 3) améliorer l'accès aux soins de prévention et de traitement du VIH/sida, et à réduire la discrimination et les stigmates associés à cette maladie.   Un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l'ACDI.

project_title: UNDP Initiative
long_description: UNDP programme title: Multi-donor Assistance for the 2005 National Election in Ethiopia.Implementing institution: Electoral Reform International Services (ERIS)Norwegian and/or other partner institution: NoneGoal:Contribute to the development of a free, open and accountable political system of governance and the consolidation of democracy in Ethiopia through the organisation and conduct of the forthcoming national elections in May 2005, in accordance with the constitution.Objectives:By the end of the project, progress towards democratic, free, fair and accessible elections will have been made in Ethiopia. It is further hoped that this will be a step in the consolidation of the pluralist and democratic political system, a process that started in the country in 1992, and will provide the necessary political stability indispensable to economic and social development of Ethiopia. Finally, it is expected that the project will contribute to the strengthening of local capacity in the organisation and management of electoral processes.Main indicators:? Fair and free elections are held. ? Substantial economic support provided to the National Election Board of Ethiop

project_title: Electoral Assistance Project - Sierra Leone
long_description: The specific project objective / Project Purpose is  to increase the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) ability to conduct their core activities in an impartial, transparent and sustainable manner .

project_title: Strengthening Electoral Processes in Zambia / Renforcement des processus électoraux en Zambie
long_description: The project aims to enhance effectiveness of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to conduct transparent and fair elections. More specifically, it aims to: enhance accuracy of the voter register; increase capacity of the National Voter Education Committee to coordinate, plan and implement continuous voter education; strengthen participation by women as candidates and strengthen organizational capacity of civil sociey organisations working in the area of women's political rights in Zambia; strengthen capacity of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to engage the media; and revise the legislative framework and code of conduct to ensure a viable and fair means of redress in the event of electoral malpractices. / Le projet vise à consolider l'efficacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie, afin que ses élections soient menées de façon transparente et juste. Plus particulièrement, il vise à : améliorer l'exactitude de l'inscription électorale; renforcer la capacité du comité national d'éducation des électeurs à coordonner, planifier et mettre en place un système d'éducation continue des électeurs; accroître la participation des femmes comme candidates aux élections et renforcer la capacité organisationnelle des organisations de la société civile qui oeuvrent pour les droits politiques de la femme en Zambie; renforcer la capacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie à faire participer les médias; réviser le cadre législatif et le code de conduite pour assurer une voie de recours viable et juste en cas de pratiques électorales malhonnêtes.

project_title: Support to SS refernd-South
long_description: Output 1 (CPAP Output 3.3) Support to civic and voter education Output 2 (CPAP Output 3.3) Media support and monitoring programme developed and implemented Output 3 (CPAP Output 3.3) Introducing of Domestic Observation Principles Output 4 (CPAP Output 3.1) Capacity Development of Southern Sudan Referendum Commission Output 5 (CPAP Output 3.1) Support to Other StakeholdersOutput 6 (CPAP 3.1) Project Management UnitOutput 7 (CPAP 3.3) Conducting Out of Country Voting Focus Area: Democratic governance. Result Area: Fostering inclusive participation. Special Outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration

project_title: NSGP
long_description: 1: An effective organizational and administrative capacity is in place to support the Office of the President (CoS, OAA)2: The President?s Office has a functional and competent policy analytical, advisory and communicative capacity to support the Office?s Constitutional Mandate and to be accountable to the citizenry.3.The Presidential Administration has developed capacity for Crisis Management and the entire Office has the requisite infrastructure and facilities to enable its effective functioning and discharging of responsibilities in all areas within the OP?s mandate. Focus Area: Democratic governance. Result Area: Fostering inclusive participation. Special Outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration

project_title: Electoral Support to Moldova
long_description: The project aims to enhance democratic governance in Moldova through improving electoral processes over the coming electoral cycles up to 2013 with immediate emphasis on the 2009 parliamentary elections. Its main specific objectives are:- To strengthen institutional and functional capacities of Central Electoral Commission - To increase efficiency of electoral information management;- To increase participation of citizens residing abroad in the electoral process, i.e. through out-of-country voting;- To increase electoral processes transparency by better usage of media;- To improve electoral legislation and judicial issues; Focus Area: Democratic governance. Result Area: Strengthening responsive governing institutions. Special Outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to reduce conflict and  manage the equitable delivery of public services

project_title: Presidential and Legislative Elections 2007 / Élections présidentielles et législatives 2007
long_description: The main objective of the project is to strengthen the democratization process in Mali by holding credible, transparent, fair, and equitable presidential and legislative elections. The purpose of the project is to build the Government of Mali's capacities and means to hold widely participatory, transparent, and credible elections.   The project is organized around the following components and activities: contribution to the election support pooled fund established by the Ministry of Territorial Administration and Local Communities (MATCL) to channel partner funds; election training, including training of staff responsible for steering, managing, and controlling the election process, as well as polling station personnel; deployment of steering, management, and control mechanisms; regulated and equitable media coverage; and management and control of security measures.   In May 2008, following the peaceful elections of 2007, the Government of Mali initiated discussions to review its electoral process, and in particular to study the possibility of adopting a permanent election management mechanism. The Canadian electoral system is one of the potential models for reform.   The project provided support to the Mali electoral process: an electoral master plan was drawn up and implemented; structures for managing and running the elections were established; the electoral card index was updated and voters lists were published; 20,333 polling stations were set up for the presidential election and 18,918 stations for the parliamentary elections, etc. This helped secure credible and transparent presidential and parliamentary elections. The project also contributed to the current debate on reform of the electoral system, opening the door to a permanent voting structure based on the Canadian model. / L'objectif du projet est de contribuer au renforcement du processus de démocratisation au Mali par la tenue d'élections présidentielles et législatives crédibles et transparentes, justes et équitables. Le but du projet est de renforcer les capacités et les moyens du gouvernement malien pour la tenue d'élections largement participatives, transparentes et crédibles.   Le projet s'articule autour des composantes et activités suivantes: contribution au fonds commun d'appui aux élections mis en place par le Ministère de l'Administration territoriale et des collectivités locales (MATCL) pour canaliser les fonds des partenaires; formation électorale, comprenant la formation du personnel chargé du pilotage, de la gestion et du contrôle du processus électoral et du personnel des bureaux de vote; déploiement des structures de pilotage et de gestion/contrôle; couverture médiatique réglementé et equitable; gestion et contrôle des mesures de sécurité.   En mai 2008, suite aux élections pacifiques de 2007, le gouvernement malien engage une réflexion pour revoir son processus électoral et en particulier étudier la possibilité d'un mécanisme de gestion des élections qui soit permanent. Le modèle du système électoral canadien fait, entre autres, partie des options retenues.   Le projet a permis d'appuyer le processus électoral au Mali : réalisation et mise en oeuvre du plan directeur de conduite du processus électoral; mise en place des structures de gestion et de conduite du processus électoral; mise à jour du fichier électoral et publication des listes électorales; Mise en place de 20 333 bureaux de vote pour la présidentielle et 18 918 bureaux pour les législatives, etc. Ceci a contribué à la tenue d'élections présidentielles et législatives fiables et transparentes. Le projet a également contribué à la réflexion en cours sur la réforme du système électoral ouvrant la porte à la création d'une structure électorale permanente inspirée du modèle canadien.

project_title: Support to the Electoral Process (STEP) program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE ELECTORAL PROCESS (STEP) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Since 2008, IFES has provided technical assistance to the Independent Election Commission (IEC) of Afghanistan through the Support to the Electoral Process in Afghanistan (STEP) project. This includes providing strategic advice and operational support to IEC departments in election administration, voter registration, electoral planning and operations, electoral security, public outreach, strategic planning, asset management, budgeting, human resource development, gender mainstreaming and on-the-spot assistance for jobs like translating documents.

project_title: Advancing Armenias Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIAS ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC).and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

project_title: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia

project_title: Sudan Election Administration Support Program (SEASP) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUDAN ELECTION ADMINISTRATION SUPPORT PROGRAM (SEASP) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of this task order will be to support technically sound administration of historic Sudanese electoral processes called for in the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) through: 1) Strengthening the capacity of election management bodies in Sudan to administer credible elections and referenda; and 2) Providing election-related commodities needed to ensure the success of these key political processes.

project_title: Rwanda 10th EDF Voice and Accountability
long_description: Strenghtening the National electoral commission for the organization and management of electoral process

long_description: Election Procedure, Preparing Election Management, Election Campaign, PR on Policy-based Election & participation in voting, etc

project_title: National Election Platform via NDI
long_description: Support to the National Electoral Platform for deployment of election observers during the voter registration period.  Includes support to administrative costs, such as salaries, purchase of various equipment and rent of office space.  The funds will be channeled through NDI, and the period for support will not exceed 6 months.

project_title: Election Support Programme
long_description: Tanzania will organice it's presidental, parliamentary and municipality elections in October 2010. UNDP, together with the government of Republic of Tanzania and it's development partners have developed an Elections Support Project (ESP) that is dedicated to strengthen the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) capasity to follow trough the elections independently and transparently. The ESP's main goal is to further strengthen national capabilities for the implementation of free, fair and credible elections, with support to the preparations, management and conduct of the elections. The focus is the strengthening of the national leadership of EMBs and engagement of political parties, media, and other civid society as well as national security management institututions in contributing to the overall goal and to prevent to post elections violence.

project_title: 2010 Electoral Support Program / Programme d'appui aux élections 2010
long_description: The 2010 Electoral Support Program's main goal is to provide technical and logistical support to Tanzania's Elections Management Bodies, the National Electoral Commission, and the Zanzibar Electoral Commission for ensuring the conduct of free, fair and credible elections, for engaging political parties, media and civil society, as well as providing support and training to government institutions tasked with maintaining public safety and security before, during and after the voting. The latter is crucial to Zanzibar, where the very close competition between the two major parties has often contributed to insecurity and violent incidents around election time.   Regarding the situation in Zanzibar, this project already delivered results. In 2010, a referendum on power-sharing was conducted in Zanzibar, following an important campaign of civic education. The referendum proceeded peacefully, to the general satisfaction of the inhabitants of Zanzibar, of the Government of Tanzania, and the international community, including Canada. / L'objectif principal du Programme d'appui aux élections 2010 est de fournir un appui technique et logistique aux commissions électorales de Tanzanie, soit la Commission électorale nationale et la Commission électorale de Zanzibar, de manière à assurer la conduite d'élections libres, justes et crédibles, à impliquer les partis politiques, les médias et la société civile et à fournir un appui et de la formation aux institutions gouvernementales chargées de maintenir l'ordre et la sécurité du public avant, pendant et après le scrutin. Ce dernier élément est crucial à Zanzibar, où la concurrence entre les deux principaux partis a souvent contribué à l'insécurité et à de violents incidents lors d'élections antérieures.   À ce titre, le projet a d'ailleurs déjà commencé à démontrer des résultats probants. En 2010, un référendum portant sur le partage du pouvoir a eu lieu à Zanzibar suivant une importante campagne d'éducation civique par le projet. Ce référendum s'est déroulé dans le calme, à la satisfaction générale des habitants de Zanzibar, du gouvernement tanzanien et de la communauté internationale, y compris le Canada.

project_title: Afghan elections support basket fund / Fonds commun de support aux élections afghanes
long_description: By working directly with the Afghan Independent Elections Commission (IEC), UNDP-ELECT offers the main vehicle through which Canada can support the core mechanisms of these elections, such as voter registration, recruitment and training of election officials, production and transportation of election materials, and verification of results, while respecting Afghan ownership over the electoral process. The programme will also support the creation of key bodies such as Electoral Complaints and Media Commissions, and key functions such as domestic observation and monitoring. In partnership with others, UNDP-ELECT will additionally support complementary programming on voter education and outreach, as well as media and police training. / En travaillant directement avec la Commission indépendante électorale afghane (IEC), le programme ELECT du PNUD est le véhicule principal à travers duquel le Canada soutiendra les mécanismes essentiels à la tenue des élections afghanes. Les activités de support incluent l'enregistrements des électeurs, le recrutement et la formation d'officiels électoraux, la production et la transportation du matériel électoral, ainsi que la vérification des résultats électoraux. Le programme supportera aussi la création d'institutions essentielles telles qu'une Commission de vérification des plaintes reliées aux élections, et une Commission médiatique. Le programme supportera également l'observation électorale domestique ainsi que l'évaluation et le suivi des résultats. En partenariat avec d'autres, ELECT financera l'éducation publique et la communication auprès des électeurs, ainsi que la formation des médias et de la police.

project_title: Kandahar University Agriculture Department Support / Appui au département d'agriculture de l'université de Kandahar
long_description: The Kandahar University Support Program will provide tangible and immediate support for the development of Kandahar University in the area of agricultural resource management expertise. The project involves the establishment, construction and provision of supplies and equipment for an Analytical Laboratory Facility at Kandahar University's experimental farm. The Analytical Laboratory Facility will provide needed support to agriculture in Kandahar province in areas that include soil testing, food technology, post-harvest physiology, seed testing and water testing. The establishment of the facility will be coupled with training for staff from Kandahar University and members from the Department of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (DAIL). This work will help to increase the capacity and resource management skills of personnel in Kandahar and will support the long-term sustainability of the project outcomes. / Afin de développer l'expertise de gestion des ressources agricoles de l'Université de Kandahar, le Programme de soutien de l'Université de Kandahar apportera un soutien concret et immédiat. Le projet implique la création, la construction et la disposition d'équipements d'un laboratoire d'analyse à la ferme expérimentale de l'Université de Kandahar. Le laboratoire d'analyse offrira le soutien nécessaire à l'agriculture dans la province de Kandahar dans des domaines tel que l'analyse du sol, la technologie alimentaire, la physiologie post-récolte, le contrôle des semences et des analyses de l'eau. La mise en place de l'installation sera couplée avec la formation du personnel de l'Université de Kandahar et des membres du ministère de l'Agriculture, de l'irrigation et de l'élevage. Ces travaux permettront d'accroître la capacité et les compétences de gestion des ressources du personnel à Kandahar et appuiera la viabilité à long terme des résultats du projet.

project_title: Sudan Political and Electoral Monitoring - 2011 Referendum / Mission d'observation électorale et politique au Soudan - Référendum de 2011
long_description: The project aimed to facilitate the legitimate, fair and peaceful delivery of the 2011 Referendum on Self Determination for South Sudan, to help ensure it would be valid in the eyes of the Sudanese people and the international community.   The January 2011 referendum, which resulted in an overwhelming 99 percent of voters in the ten states of South Sudan voting for independence, was one of the final steps in the implementation of the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA). Through a contribution to The Carter Centre's South Sudan referendum observation mission, the project supported the deployment of international observers to monitor and report on the referendum process, including voter registration, polling and tabulation across Sudan, as well as Out-of-Country Voting. The project also supported the observation of the South Kordofan elections (postponed) in May 2011, as well as the popular consultation process in this state. / Le projet visait à faciliter la tenue légitime, équitable et pacifique du référendum de 2011 sur l'indépendance du Sud-Soudan, afin de s'assurer que le résultat soit valable aux yeux de tous les soudanais ainsi que de la communauté internationale.   Le référendum de janvier 2011, lequel résulta par une écrasante majorité avec 99 % des électeurs dans les dix États du Sud-Soudan votant pour l'indépendance, fut l'une des étapes finales prévues dans la mise en application de l'Accord Global de Paix. En contribuant à la mission d'observation du référendum par le Centre Carter, le projet a supporté le déploiement d'observateurs internationaux afin de surveiller et rapporter le processus référendaire, incluant l'enregistrement des électeurs, la participation électorale et la tabulation à travers le Soudan, ainsi que les votes à l'extérieur du pays. Ce projet supporte également l'observation des élections au Kordofan Sud en mai 2011, ainsi que le processus de la consultation populaire qui eue lieu dans le méme Etat.

project_title: Canadian Crossroads International - Volunteer Sending 2009-2014 / Carrefour Canadien International - Envoi de volontaires 2009-2014
long_description: This volunteer sending program supports 459 volunteer placements which contribute to the development objectives of 30 developing-country organizations in collaboration with 30 Canadian organizations. These placements (or assignments/exchanges) and partnerships strengthen the capacity of partner organizations from developing countries to achieve development results through the sharing of skills and knowledge related to program delivery, organizational management, and engagement in policy dialogue. Canadian Crossroads International (CCI) is focusing on three areas of development, all within a gender equality framework: (1) women's rights through increased political representation and reduced violence against women; (2) poverty reduction through increased access to resources and a stronger social economy; and (3) improved access to preventative care and treatment of HIV/AIDS and reduction of discrimination and stigma associated with this disease.   An amount of $80,622 has been added to the total amount for each of the Volunteer Cooperation Agency programs for CIDA-led program evaluations. / Ce programme d'envoi de volontaires soutient 459 échanges de bénévoles qui contribuent aux objectifs de développement de 30 organisations des pays en développement en collaboration avec 30 organisations canadiennes. Ces stages (ou missions/échanges) et ces partenariats renforcent la capacité des organisations partenaires des pays en développement à atteindre des résultats en développement à travers le partage de compétences et de connaissances qui se rapportent à la gestion de programme, à la gestion organisationnelle, et à la participation au dialogue politique. Carrefour Canadien International (CCI) vise trois secteurs de développement, tous dans le cadre de l'égalité entre les sexes : 1) défendre les droits des femmes en augmentant leur représentation politique et, réduire la violence faite aux femmes; 2) réduire la pauvreté en augmentant l'accès aux ressources et en renforçant l'économie sociale; 3) améliorer l'accès aux soins de prévention et de traitement du VIH/sida, et à réduire la discrimination et les stigmates associés à cette maladie.   Un montant de $ 80 622 a été ajouté au montant total pour chaque programme des organisations de coopération volontaire, pour les évaluations de programmes menées par l'ACDI.

project_title: Civil Society and Governance Support / Appui à la gouvernance et à la société civile
long_description: The goal of the project is to support the governance capacities of a select group of government, civil society and private sector institutions in an effort to ensure a responsible, equitable state that respects the rights of its citizens. Areas of support include: judicial administration, management of public funds, the electoral process, democratic development and ensuring basic human rights are upheld in Cameroon. As a result of this project the men and women of Cameroon are expected to be better informed as to their individual rights, to be more involved in their communities and able to actively improve their quality of life. / L'objectif du projet est d'appuyer les capacités en matière de gouvernance d'un groupe choisi d'organismes publics et privés et de la société civile, en vue d'encourager l'émergence d'un État responsable et équitable respectueux des droits de ses citoyens. Font l'objet d'un appui l'administration judiciaire, la gestion des fonds publics, le processus électoral, le développement démocratique et le respect des droits humains fondamentaux au Cameroun. Grâce à ce projet, les hommes et les femmes de ce pays connaissent mieux leurs droits individuels, s'impliquent davantage dans leur collectivité et sont mieux outillés pour travailler activement à l'amélioration de leur qualité de vie.

project_title: Support to Elections N -Sudan
long_description: Output 1: Civic and voter education program developed and commencedOutput 2: Media support and monitoring program developed and commencedOutput 3: Support to electoral management bodiesOutput 4: Support to other stakeholdersOutput 5: Set up of the project Management Unit Focus Area: Democratic governance. Result Area: Fostering inclusive participation. Special Outcome: Electoral laws, processes and institutions strengthen inclusive participation and professional electoral administration

project_title: SUPPORT TO ELECTORAL REFORMS
long_description: The objectives of this project are to support the reform programme of the Malawi Electoral Commission to become a more effective, responsive accountable and credible electoral management organization in Malawi and to provide support to elections in Malawi. The project serves as a mechanism for harmonised donor and government support to the reforms and elections. It provides support for capacity building of the MEC in both the short and long term, support for the establishment of a credible computerized voters? register, support to elections budget and support to CSOs and the MEC for civic and voter education. Focus Area: Democratic governance. Result Area: Strengthening responsive governing institutions. Special Outcome: National, regional and local levels of governance expand their capacities to reduce conflict and  manage the equitable delivery of public services

project_title: ZAMBIA PROGRAMME EXPENDITURE - Improve democratic Governance - ZAMBIA GOVERNACE FOUNDATION(ZGF) - ELECTION MONITORING COALITION 2011-Elections1GOV-Governance-GOV-Governance
short_description: IMPROVE DEMOCRATIC GOVERNANCE - ZAMBIA GOVERNACE FOUNDATION(ZGF) - ELECTION MONITORING COALITION 2011-ELECTIONS1GOV-GOVERNANCE-GOV-GOVERNANCE
long_description: In 2011 Irish Aid will continue its focus on both the demand and supply side of good governance. Current support to Parliament will continue as will core support to increasing media access. The governance advocacy efforts of a range of civil society organisations will continue to be supported through co-funding arrangements with other donors. Anticipated results include increased citizen engagement in the 2011 elections; transparency in the conduct of national elections; monitoring of government spending and evidence of improved engagement in policy dialogue. Additional work in this area in 2011 includes deepening Irish Aid's engagement in public financial management across the programme, and support to the One UN approach given its strategic importance to Irish Aid and the potential for increasing the effectiveness of the multilateral agencies working in Zambia

long_description: UNDP programme title: Multi-donor Assistance for the 2005 National Election in Ethiopia.Implementing institution: Electoral Reform International Services (ERIS)Norwegian and/or other partner institution: NoneGoal: Contribute to the development of a free, open and accountable political system of governance and the consolidation of democracy in Ethiopia through the organisation and conduct of the forthcoming national elections in May 2005, in accordance with the constitution.Objectives: By the end of the project, progress towards democratic, free, fair and accessible elections will have been made in Ethiopia. It is further hoped that this will be a step in the consolidation of the pluralist and democratic political system, a process that started in the country in 1992, and will provide the necessary political stability indispensable to economic and social development of Ethiopia. Finally, it is expected that the project will contribute to the strengthening of local capacity in the organisation and management of electoral processes.Main indicators: ? project_title: Strengthening Electoral Processes in Zambia / Renforcement des processus électoraux en Zambie
short_description: STRENGTHENING ELECTORAL PROCESSES IN ZAMBIA / RENFORCEMENT DES PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAUX EN ZAMBIE
long_description: The project aims to enhance effectiveness of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to conduct transparent and fair elections. More specifically, it aims to: enhance accuracy of the voter register; increase capacity of the National Voter Education Committee to coordinate, plan and implement continuous voter education; strengthen participation by women as candidates and strengthen organizational capacity of civil society organisations working in the area of women's political rights in Zambia; strengthen capacity of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to engage the media; and revise the legislative framework and code of conduct to ensure a viable and fair means of redress in the event of electoral malpractices. / Le projet vise à consolider l'efficacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie, afin que ses élections soient menées de faÃ§on transparente et juste. Plus particulièrement, il vise à : améliorer l'exactitude de l'inscription électorale; renforcer la capacité du comité national d'éducation des électeurs à coordonner, planifier et mettre en place un système d'éducation continue des électeurs; accroitre la participation des femmes comme candidates aux élections et renforcer la capacité organisationnelle des organisations de la société civile qui oeuvrent pour les droits politiques de la femme en Zambie; renforcer la capacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie à faire participer les médias; réviser le cadre législatif et le code de conduite pour assurer une voie de recours viable et juste en cas de pratiques électorales malhonnêtes.

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Ensuring Effective Electoral Reform in Tunisia
short_description: ENSURING EFFECTIVE ELECTORAL REFORM IN TUNISIA
long_description: The importance of credible elections for the democratic transition of Tunisia cannot be understated.  The Tunisian authorities have committed to hold elections, possibly for a Constituent Assembly, by mid-July.  Yet for the election to be considered credible, the quality of the Tunisian voter register will need to be assured.  The current voter register is considered to be out of date and inaccurate, and will allow for the participation of only a proportion of eligible citizens.  Alternative methods for improving the voter register  including through creating a new register to be extracted form the National ID card database  may be effective but are untested. The body responsible for determining whether or not to adopt a new voter register during their preparations of a new Electoral Code  the Technical Commission for Political Reform and Democratic Transition (TCPR)  has limited technical knowledge and experience in core electoral issues generally, and on approaches for voter registration reform in particular.  In order to successfully address the issues related to voter registration, the TCPR needs immediate support to build its capacity through technical advice and assistance.  IFES proposes to provide rapid response to the TCPR's needs via the provision of immediate expert consultations and assistance, including for the possibility of feasibility studies and reviews of proposed options.

project_title: Advancing Armenias Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIAS ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC).and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

project_title: Elections and Political Processes - Election Management

long_description: Elections and Political Processes - Support electoral management bodies to conduct elections, formal adjudication of electoral disputes, and security for elections.

project_title: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The aim of this Building Sustainable Election Management in Liberia project is to increase the capacity of the NEC to efficiently, effectively, and impartially manage the upcoming elections. IFES support to building the NECs institutional and professional capacity will allow it to conduct elections with decreasing levels of international support.

project_title: Fair Elections and Institutional Reforms / Élections justes et réformes institutionnelles
short_description: FAIR ELECTIONS AND INSTITUTIONAL REFORMS / ÉLECTIONS JUSTES ET RÉFORMES INSTITUTIONNELLES
long_description: Through this project, CIDA is collaborating with The Asia Foundation, local civil society partner organizations (including the 34-member Election Working Group or EWG), the Bangladesh Election Commission, and other bilateral agencies. The purpose of the project is to strengthen an enabling environment for a free, fair, and non-violent 2008 parliamentary election whose results are accepted by the people of Bangladesh, major political actors, and the international community. Program activities are focused on building domestic monitoring capacity, including the deployment of 165,000 volunteer monitors on Election Day; coordination with international observer missions; voter and civic education on priority thematic issues (prevention of violence, democratic representation and accountability, women's participation, first-time voters, rights of disabled persons; and ethnic and religious minorities); assisting the Bangladesh Election Commission with the voter registration process; and conducting dialogues with the political parties and candidates, police and other law enforcement officials, local government officials, civil society, and citizens on the steps to be taken to ensure a free and fair election. / Par le biais de ce projet, l'ACDI collabore avec la Asia Fondation, des organisations partenaires de la société civile (y compris le Groupe de travail sur les élections composé de 34 membres),la Commission électorale du Bangladesh et d'autres organisations bilatérales. Le but du projet est de créer un environnement plus propice en vue de la tenue d'élections parlementaires libres, justes et pacifiques en 2008 dont les résultats seront acceptés par la population bangladaise, par les principaux acteurs politiques et la communauté internationale. Les activités de programme sont axées sur le renforcement des capacités en matière de surveillance locale, y compris le déploiement de 165000 observateurs électoraux le jour du scrutin; la coordination avec les missions d'observateurs internationaux; l'éducation civique des électeurs au sujet des questions thématiques prioritaires (prévention de la violence, représentation démocratique et responsabilisation, participation des femmes, nouveaux électeurs, droits des personnes handicapées, minorités ethniques et religieuses); le soutien à la Commission électorale relativement au processus d'inscription des électeurs; la tenue de dialogues avec les partis politiques, les candidats, la police et d'autres responsables de l'application de la loi, des hauts fonctionnaires locaux, des membres de la société civile et des citoyens au sujet des mesures à prendre pour garantir la tenue d'élections libres et justes.

short_description: SUPPORT TO THE AFGHAN INDEPENDENT ELECTORAL COMMISSION TO DEVELOP AND CONSOLIDATE CAPACITY FOR FUTURE ELECTIONS
long_description: To assist the Afghanistan IEC to develop its capacities, providing input to electoral reform and developing strategies for voter registration and electoral boundary delimitation. Funds will be channelled through the UNDP ELECT II basket fund.

project_title: UGANDA PROGRAMME EXPENDITURE - Unallocated - GOVERNANCE - ELECTION PEACE RALLY FUND-Elections1GRNT-Grant Payments-ZZ-NOT ANALYSED
short_description: GOVERNANCE - ELECTION PEACE RALLY FUND-ELECTIONS-GRANT PAYMENTS
long_description: Irish Aid will continue to play a major role in governance through support for the Justice Law and Order Sector, complemented by assistance to legal aid service providers through the Legal Aid Basket Fund. Support will also be provided to help strengthen democratic governance institutions such as Parliament, the Office of the Auditor General and the Uganda Human Rights Commission. A selected number of civil society organisations engaged in human rights and accountability work will be assisted. Public financial management and the promotion of gender budgeting will continue to be a priority for support. In 2011, Ireland will assume the Chair of the Partners for Democracy Group (PDG), a Head of Mission level group which engages in political and policy dialogue with the Government of Uganda on democratic governance issues.

project_title: UGANDA PROGRAMME EXPENDITURE - Unallocated - GOVERNANCE - SUPPORT TO EALS TO OBSERV-Elections1GRNT-Grant Payments-GOV-Governance
short_description: GOVERNANCE - SUPPORT TO EALS TO OBSERV-ELECTIONSGOV-GOVERNANCE
long_description: Irish Aid will continue to play a major role in governance through support for the Justice Law and Order Sector, complemented by assistance to legal aid service providers through the Legal Aid Basket Fund. Support will also be provided to help strengthen democratic governance institutions such as Parliament, the Office of the Auditor General and the Uganda Human Rights Commission. A selected number of civil society organisations engaged in human rights and accountability work will be assisted. Public financial management and the promotion of gender budgeting will continue to be a priority for support. In 2011, Ireland will assume the Chair of the Partners for Democracy Group (PDG), a Head of Mission level group which engages in political and policy dialogue with the Government of Uganda on democratic governance issues.

project_title: Strengthening Election Processes / Renforcement du processus électoral
short_description: STRENGTHENING ELECTION PROCESSES / RENFORCEMENT DU PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL
long_description: The project contributes to strengthening democratic electoral procedures and practices in Ukraine through the following components: the establishment and introduction of a unified state voter register, which includes the implementation of a national voter awareness campaign on rights and responsibilities towards the register; assistance in electoral legislation codification; increasing the level of professionalism of election officials; and promoting a wider participation of women and gender awareness during the electoral process. / Le projet contribue à renforcer les politiques et procédures électorales démocratiques en Ukraine. Les composantes du projet sont : l'établissement d'un registre électoral national unifié, incluant la mise en oeuvre d'une campagne nationale de sensibilisation des électeurs sur leurs droits et responsabilités envers le registre; un appui à la codification de la législation électorale; l'amélioration du niveau de professionnalisme des agents électoraux. Le projet fera également la promotion d'une plus grande participation des femmes et d'une sensibilisation sur la question de l'égalité entre les femmes et les hommes pendant le processus électoral.

project_title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow (ELECT) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ENHANCING LEGAL AND ELECTORAL CAPACITY FOR TOMORROW (ELECT) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The ELECT project strengthens the ability of the Afghan government to conduct free and fair elections through technical support targeting Independent Elections Commission (IEC). Main objectives of the project are ongoing institutional strengthening of the IEC, exploring ways to improve voter registration and focusing on civic and voter education. Assistance to the IEC is provided in the form of Technical Advisors, who are working in partnership with their Afghan counterparts from the IEC. These advisors are not expected to take a lead in electoral administration decision making, but rather provide specialized and targeted support to the various IEC departments heads enhancing their preparations for the future round of elections. In partnership with other donor countries, USAID support to the IEC through the UNDP ELECT basket fund will help Afghan government deliver free, fair and credible elections with results that are broadly accepted by majority of Afghan people.

short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO YOUTH FORUM FOR POLITICAL PROCESSES.
long_description: To promote youth participation in Zimbabwe s electoral process. The Youth Forum will mobilize registered youth to become frequent voters, non-registered youth to register, and to educate youth about the role of political parties. Youth Forum will facilitate the formation of new voters s clubs and conduct focus group discussions, voter education workshops and voter registration outreaches to youth in townships and rural (mining and farming) communities in four districts in Masvingo province and four in Mashonaland province.
