The Zimbabwe Human Rights Association (ZimRights) will promote civic and voter education, encourage voter registration, and conduct a get out the vote campaign in the urban areas of Harare, Bulawayo, Masvingo, Manicaland and Midlands. ZimRights will also advocate for national electoral reforms and other democratic reforms and legislation.

project_title: Deepening Democracy in Tanzania Program / Programme d'approfondissement de la démocratie en Tanzania
short_description: DEEPENING DEMOCRACY IN TANZANIA PROGRAM / PROGRAMME D'APPROFONDISSEMENT DE LA DÉMOCRATIE EN TANZANIA
long_description: The Deepening Democracy in Tanzania Program (DDTP) supports four broad strategic areas of democracy in Tanzania, namely: 1) the Facilitation and implementation of the African Peer Review Mechanism; 2) the elections management bodies and the electoral process; 3) civic education; and 4) good and accountable governance.   These broad strategic areas have been selected following extensive consultations with government, civil society and development partners. The expected results of the DDTP are to secure and expand democratic achievements to date by strengthening the capacity of democratic institutions, including Parliament, the House of Representatives, the election management bodies of Tanzania and Zanzibar, civil society, the media, and political parties through training, technical assistance and relevant activities. / Le Programme d'appronfondissement de la démocratie en Tanzanie appuie quatre domaines de la démocratie en Tanzanie, soit : 1) la facilitation et mise en oeuvre du Mécanisme africain d'évaluation par les pairs; 2) les institutions de supervision électorale; 3) l'éducation civique; 4) la gouvernance et l'imputabilité.   Ces domaines ont été choisis suite à des consultations avec le gouvernement, la société civile et les donateurs. Les résultats attendus sont d'encrer et d'augmenter les réalisations démocratiques faites à ce jour en renforÃ§ant les capacités des institutions démocratiques, y compris le Parlement, la Chambre des Représentants, les institutions de supervision électorale de la Tanzanie et de Zanzibar, la société civile, les médias et les partis politiques par voie de diverses formations, de la provision d'assistance technique et d'autres activités pertinentes.

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Elections Canada and Responsive Fund Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Volet Élections Canada et fonds réactif
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - ELECTIONS CANADA AND RESPONSIVE FUND COMPONENT / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - VOLET ÉLECTIONS CANADA ET FONDS RÉA
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes taking place between 2009 and 2011. It includes technical and material support to the Provisional Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project includes activities implemented by Haitian civil society organizations, technical support by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes, and the establishment of a responsive fund.   CIDA is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - UNDP Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total. / L'objectif du projet d'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux qui ont lieu entre 2009 et 2011, notamment par l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral provisoire et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet vise la mise en place d'activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile haïtienne, un appui technique fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haïtiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux et la mise en place d'un fonds réactif.   L'ACDI appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Volet PNUD. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Ukraine Election Observers
long_description: In his letter to Minister Oda dated 4 June 2012, Minister Baird expressed support for CIDA's plan to deploy election observers to Ukraine to monitor the upcoming October 2012 parliamentary elections. To ensure Canada's overall election observation mission is as robust as possible, Minister Baird offered the support of Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada. This project supports the Minister's commitment for democratic reform in Ukraine through support for free and fair elections.The forthcoming Ukrainian election marks a crucial point in the country's democratic development. Since President Yanukovych assumed office in 2010, human rights and democracy have suffered. The arrests and conviction of several high-ranking members of the opposition have called into question Yanukovych's commitment to democracy and democratic institutions, and have jeopardized a level electoral playing field. There is also concern of increasing repression and self-censorship of independent media sources in the country.The CIDA-driven project aims to deploy 500 Canadian long-term (LTOs) and short-term observes (STOs) to support the delivery of free and fair Ukrainin parliamentary elections in October 2012.  The project enables 425 independent STOs to ensure the transparency and fairness of the election process on voting day and 75 LTOs to provide impartial assessments of the pre-election period.75 LTO being dispatched between September and October425 STO leaving for Ukraine 1 week prior to election date (Oct 28, 2012)DFAIT is paying CIDA $3.5M for the bilateral observation mission, broken down as follows:Up to 110 Short-term observers        $    665,000 - includes up to 10 Parliamentarians through OSCE-PAUp to   40 Long-term Observers         $ 2,415,000CANADEM Overhead                          $    420,000Letter of agreement between DFAIT and OSCE-PA shows up to $80,333.82 for 10 eligible Parliamentarians to attend, but we are only paying for 9.  As of Oct 30, 2012 we agreed to amend from the budgeted $81K to include the cost of P. Goldring at $12,000.  Total $94,000.  Formal amendment pending final tabulation of costs for the 9 participants. (P. Goldring was sent via travel letter from IRC)_______________________There are two ways to crunch the numbers to reflect the fact that in Mission Canada STOs there is in fact one parliamentarian - who is unable to deploy under the OSCE-PA regulations: 425 short-term             - 345 Mission Canada - including one parliamentarian             - 60 OSCE             - 10 parliamentarians - OSCE- PA             - 10 mission mgt staff 75 long-term             - 65 Mission Canada             - 10 OSCE  OR420 - Mission Canada Ukraine Elections 2012:         - 345 STOs - including one parliamentarian         - 10 - Mission management staff (who become STOs on e-day)         - 65 LTOs (who become STOs on e-day) 80 - OSCE:       - 10 LTOs         - 60 STOs         - 10 Parliamentarians (through OSCE-PA)

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Electoral Assistance in Libya
long_description: In the wake of the revolution in Libya, the importance of credible elections for democratic transition cannot be understated.  The National Transitional Council (NTC) has committed itself to holding elections for the General National Congress (GNC) in June 2012 per the Constitutional Declaration of August 3, 2011.  These elections will be Libya's first in 40 years, and ensuring that the newly formed High National Election Commission (HNEC) has the tools necessary to conduct elections is critical for demonstrating to Libyan citizens that the NTC is indeed committed to having a transparent transition of power to a democratically elected body.  For the elections to be considered credible, both domestically and internationally, IFES has â' as a result of its technical assessment conducted between November 2011 and February 2012 â' identified and prioritized several areas that, require assistance, including: the development of a system for electoral dispute resolution (EDR), strategic communications, and establishment of an accurate voter register.  IFES has extensive experience in these technical areas and would provide technical assistance and support to the HNEC under the UN Libya Coordinated Needs Assessment (LCNA) framework.

project_title: UNDP Support for the Timorese Electoral Cycle
short_description: UNDP SUPPORT FOR THE TIMORESE ELECTORAL CYCLE
long_description: Timor-Leste?s presidential and legislative elections in 2007 were the first national post-independence elections organized by the Timorese and as such represented an important step in the consolidation of democracy in the country. The next parliamentary elections are to be held in July 2012. The UNDP Support to the Timorese Electoral Cycle project using an Electoral Cycle Approach supports the capacity development of the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) in Timor-Leste:  The Technical Secretariat for Electoral Administration (STAE) and the National Commission on Elections (CNE) and the political parties. Based on the lessons learned from electoral support in Timor-Leste and in view of the need to further strengthen the human and institutional capacity of the national electoral management bodies and political parties the project provides selected assistance in priority areas throughout the preparation and implementation of upcoming parliamentary elections. The activities are 1) advisory support for the STAE and CNE including expert and technical assistance in the pre-electoral period and individual mentoring in the post-electoral period and 2) support to voter and civic education in designing and producing a comprehensive range of voter and civic education campaigns.  The project activities cover all the districts of Timor-Leste and the duration of the project is from July to December 2012. The Timorese Electoral Cycle project is expected to conclude in December 2012.

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Support to Democratic Transition in Libya
short_description: SUPPORT TO DEMOCRATIC TRANSITION IN LIBYA
long_description: Having suffered for more than four decades of dictatorship, the Libyan people lack any kind of meaningful experience of a political life and practice, as well as of civic initiative. This reality, coupled with the absence of representative institutions, has created a vacuum that urgently needs to be filled appropriately and qualitatively in order to enable a peaceful transition to democracy and stability. In particular the youth, representing over 67% of the Libyan population, and women are two groups that continue to face exclusion and lack of opportunity, including political opportunity. Women's empowerment, especially political empowerment, is of paramount importance during this transition period in a society where women have traditionally suffered from exclusion and lack of representation. Efforts are needed, by International IDEA and others, to assist a broad range of Libyan stakeholders interested in implementing activities targeting the political empowerment of women, both as voters and as candidates in the coming elections. The National Transitional Council (NTC) has adopted an ambitious roadmap for the transitional process, including the election of a constituent assembly to prepare a new and democratic social contract for the country. Considering the many gaps in the previous social contract (if it can even be considered such) and the various challenges facing the country in this transitional phase, there is a need to build national capacities to conduct credible, free and fair elections that produce a legitimate authority and thus provide a basis for the Constituent Assembly to operate effectively. All support initiatives would need to adopt a holistic approach that looks at both Nation Building and State Building in order to create an environment conducive to democracy.A.Actions related to electoral support:1.Policy advice and technical support to the NTC, the Libyan government and other relevant parties, especially the electoral management bodies on electoral law and the conduct of elections;2.Support for the establishment of an independent electoral management body;3.Capacity building and training of electoral officials, both at the central/national and the local levels;4.Support and training to domestic election observers.B.Actions related to women's empowerment:1.Support to emerging initiatives for the establishment of a Women's National Council intended to implement a mandate to enhance the conditions and foster a conducive environment for women's engagement in the transitional process;2.Tailored and contextualized programmes to support women candidates to increase their chances and to enhance the levels of awareness about the need to include women among the elective options. This may be followed by support to winning women representatives;3.Provision of support/training to political parties (or movements), as needed, on internal party laws and regulations to include women in the âparty systemâ.

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Citizen Voter List Monitoring - Ukraine Parliamentary Elections
short_description: CITIZEN VOTER LIST MONITORING - UKRAINE PARLIAMENTARY ELECTIONS
long_description: PROJECT BACKGROUND:In October 2012, Ukraine will conduct critical parliamentary elections which will determine the trajectory of the country for the foreseeable future. Because the parliamentary election law, heavily criticized by the Venice Commission for failing to create a level playing field for participating candidates and parties, failed to address adequately concerns about the transparency and administrative control of the national registry of voters, the Civil Initiative Support Center of Ukraine (CISC - www.cisc.org.ua) undertook a project in late 2011 to train Ukrainians to exercise their legal rights to obtain and confirm the accuracy of their personal information on the list. This project identified several areas of concern which, if unaddressed, will preclude a free and fair parliamentary election. With funding from the National Endowment for Democracy, and through technical support from the International Republican Institute (IRI), CISC initiated this voter registry project which targeted 174 of the 756 representative offices of the State Registry of Voters administrative bodies operating in Ukraine. This project resulted in 522 Ukrainian citizens sending official inquiries about their local voter lists to Regional Departments of the State Register of Voters and approximately 200 inquiries to the Central Electoral Committee. PURPOSE:Given the problems related to voter registry that were identified in its initial project, CISC proposes a second stage of the program to conduct activities seeking to increase the transparent and efficient work of administrative bodies of the State Registry while working to prevent the disenfranchisement of Ukrainian voters on election day. IRI will provide project management oversight and be DFAIT's direct project partner for this initiative, while also continuing to provide technical assistance to CISC.ACTIVITIES:- Dissemination of 175,000 informational brochures on âPublic access to the State Registry of Votersâ - One national-level general training for all program participants including CISC coalition members. - Twenty-seven regional roundtables for information dissemination (one in each oblast and the capital).- Three thousand seven hundred and eighty inquiries to all 756 administrative bodies of the state register. - Questionnaires for the public on the efficiency and transparency of the work of the administrative bodies of the State Registry. - Official inquiries from Ukrainian voters to 378 administrative bodies of the state register of voters to gauge responsiveness prior to the election (about 50% of state registry departments). - The State Registry will be informed about the necessity of following Ukrainian legislation to respond to citizen's issues and concerns. - Continuous monitoring of the voter register and the eventual voter list. - Development of nationwide social network leveraging CISC's 3,000+ current activists and supporters and utilizing crowdsourcing technologies to map out an

project_title: Support to the Electoral Process (STEP) program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE ELECTORAL PROCESS (STEP) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Since 2008, IFES has provided technical assistance to the Independent Election Commission (IEC) of Afghanistan through the Support to the Electoral Process in Afghanistan (STEP) project. This includes providing strategic advice and operational support to IEC departments in election administration, voter registration, electoral planning and operations, electoral security, public outreach, strategic planning, asset management, budgeting, human resource development, gender mainstreaming and on-the-spot assistance for jobs like translating documents.

project_title: PIANZEA Electoral Activities
long_description: The Pacific Partnership with Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) aims to enhance the capacity of electoral administrators and improve the governance and sustainability of electoral management bodies through training, development of strategic plans, upgrading of the Generic Voter Registration System database roll in Vanuatu and the establishment of a Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators (PIANZEA) website to provide members with a means to communicate and capture electoral issues and events. The total value of this initiative is $2.5 million over 3 years, starting 2011-12.

project_title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow (ELECT) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ENHANCING LEGAL AND ELECTORAL CAPACITY FOR TOMORROW (ELECT) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The ELECT project strengthens the ability of the Afghan government to conduct free and fair elections through technical support targeting Independent Elections Commission (IEC). Main objectives of the project are ongoing institutional strengthening of the IEC, exploring ways to improve voter registration and focusing on civic and voter education. Assistance to the IEC is provided in the form of Technical Advisors, who are working in partnership with their Afghan counterparts from the IEC. These advisors are not expected to take a lead in electoral administration decision making, but rather provide specialized and targeted support to the various IEC departments heads enhancing their preparations for the future round of elections. In partnership with other donor countries, USAID support to the IEC through the UNDP ELECT basket fund will help Afghan government deliver free, fair and credible elections with results that are broadly accepted by majority of Afghan people.

project_title: Sudan Election Administration Support Program (SEASP) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUDAN ELECTION ADMINISTRATION SUPPORT PROGRAM (SEASP) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of this task order will be to support technically sound administration of historic Sudanese electoral processes called for in the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) through: 1) Strengthening the capacity of election management bodies in Sudan to administer credible elections and referenda; and 2) Providing election-related commodities needed to ensure the success of these key political processes.

project_title: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The aim of this Building Sustainable Election Management in Liberia project is to increase the capacity of the NEC to efficiently, effectively, and impartially manage the upcoming elections. IFES support to building the NECs institutional and professional capacity will allow it to conduct elections with decreasing levels of international support.

project_title: Strengthening Electoral Processes in Zambia / Renforcement des processus électoraux en Zambie
short_description: STRENGTHENING ELECTORAL PROCESSES IN ZAMBIA / RENFORCEMENT DES PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAUX EN ZAMBIE
long_description: The project aims to enhance effectiveness of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to conduct transparent and fair elections. More specifically, it aims to: enhance accuracy of the voter register; increase capacity of the National Voter Education Committee to coordinate, plan and implement continuous voter education; strengthen participation by women as candidates and strengthen organizational capacity of civil society organisations working in the area of women's political rights in Zambia; strengthen capacity of the Electoral Commission of Zambia to engage the media; and revise the legislative framework and code of conduct to ensure a viable and fair means of redress in the event of electoral malpractices. / Le projet vise à consolider l'efficacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie, afin que ses élections soient menées de façon transparente et juste. Plus particulièrement, il vise à : améliorer l'exactitude de l'inscription électorale; renforcer la capacité du comité national d'éducation des électeurs à coordonner, planifier et mettre en place un système d'éducation continue des électeurs; accroître la participation des femmes comme candidates aux élections et renforcer la capacité organisationnelle des organisations de la société civile qui oeuvrent pour les droits politiques de la femme en Zambie; renforcer la capacité de la Commission électorale de Zambie à faire participer les médias; réviser le cadre législatif et le code de conduite pour assurer une voie de recours viable et juste en cas de pratiques électorales malhonnêtes.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: EISA Electoral Institute of South.Africa
long_description: This project will build on experiences from a six year cooperation between EISA and SDC in building and strengthening the capacity of election stakeholders and the development and application of Election Management, Monitoring and Observation Principles (PEMMO) in the SADC Region. The overall objective of the programme is to contribute to the deepening of democracy by enhancing the capacity of election stakeholders, including Electoral Management bodies, SADC-ESN Civil Society Organisations and political parties, to manage, support and monitor elections in a sustainable manner in the SADC region.

project_title: Centre for Governance and Development - Comprehensive Monitoring and Obseravtion of 2012 Elections
short_description: CENTRE FOR GOVERNANCE AND DEVELOPMENT - COMPREHENSIVE MONITORING AND OBSERAVTION OF 2012 ELECTIONS
long_description: Election observation is defined as the purposeful gathering of information regarding an electoral process and making informed judgements about the process on the basis of information collected. Over the years election observation in Kenya has largely focused on Election Day processes and activities an approach that fails to take into cognizance the environment and processes prior to and after the elections. ELOG has organized itself as a comprehensive election monitoring and observation programme. Its aim is to promote trasparency and accountability in the lectoral processes in Kenya and the Africa Region. Taking elections as a process and not an event ELOG has identified seven key thematic issues under which thematic monitoring and observation shall be anchored namely: voter registration monitoring and implenetation of political parties Act and political financing advocacy on electoral law reform and constituency delimitation campaign monitoring promotion and participation of marginalized groups voter education and media monitoring. This is anticipated to set a comprehensive background and environment for actual election-day monittoring and observation which will utize the traditional observation and parallel vote tabulation methodologies for purposes of deterring electoral malpractices and the swift verification of the official results and the credibility of the election-day processesObjectives; to enhance stakeholder awareness on the electoral process undertake comprehensive thematic monitoring and observation of electora process leading to and after the 2012 elections to faciliate the stablishment and build capacity for a peace panel to undertake election day observation through fielding general observers and parallel vote tabulation observers

project_title: LESOTHO COUNTRY PROGRAMME IMPRESTS - Governannce Unspecified - JOINT DEMO. & GOVERN PROG - 1372-Elections -Sundry expenses-GOV-Governance
short_description: LESOTHO COUNTRY PROGRAMME IMPRESTS - GOVERNANNCE UNSPECIFIED - JOINT DEMO. & GOVERN PROG - 1372-ELECTIONS -SUNDRY EXPENSES-GOV-GOVERNANCE
long_description: Continued support will be provided to a joint Consolidation of Democracy and Good Governance Programme managed by UNDP. The programme is helping to build the capacity of Parliament, the Independent Electoral Commission , the Office of the Ombudsman and the proposed new Human Rights Commission. A more coherent results based plan has been developed with the partners. A final disbursement for the current public financial management capacity building programme will be made in early 2012

project_title: Support to Tanzania's Parliament and Electoral Management bodies
short_description: SUPPORT TO TANZANIA'S PARLIAMENT AND ELECTORAL MANAGEMENT BODIES
long_description: To provide support in strengthening Tanzania's key democratic institutions of Parliament, constitution and elections through enhanced organisational capacity and effective citizen participation by 2015.

project_title: CONSOLIDATING ZIMBABWE ELECTORAL COMMISSION (ZEC) INSITUTIONAL CAPACITY THROUGH ENHANCING HUMAN RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE
short_description: CONSOLIDATING ZIMBABWE ELECTORAL COMMISSION (ZEC) INSITUTIONAL CAPACITY THROUGH ENHANCING HUMAN RESOURCES AND INFRASTRUCTURE
long_description: To strengthen the institutional and technical capacity of ZEC for effective and efficitent management of its perenial function

short_description: STRENGTHENING THE TECHNICAL CAPACITY OF THE ZIMBABWE ELECTORAL COMMISSION (ZEC)
long_description: The overall objective is to strengthen the capacity of the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission for effective and efficient management of its duties

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Elections Canada and Responsive Fund Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Volet Élections Canada et fonds réactif
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - ELECTIONS CANADA AND RESPONSIVE FUND COMPONENT / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - VOLET ÉLECTIONS CANADA ET FONDS RÉA
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes taking place between 2009 and 2011. It includes technical and material support to the Provisional Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project includes activities implemented by Haitian civil society organizations, technical support by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes, and the establishment of a responsive fund.   CIDA is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - UNDP Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total. / L'objectif du projet d'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux qui ont lieu entre 2009 et 2011, notamment par l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral provisoire et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet vise la mise en place d'activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile haïtienne, un appui technique fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haïtiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux et la mise en place d'un fonds réactif.   L'ACDI appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Volet PNUD. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.

project_title: Electoral Institute for the Sustainability of Democracy in Africa (EISA): Africa Democracy Strengthening Programme Phase II EISA Program Supp 2011-14
short_description: ELECTORAL INSTITUTE FOR THE SUSTAINABILITY OF DEMOCRACY IN AFRICA (EISA): AFRICA DEMOCRACY STRENGTHENING PROGRAMME PHASE II EISA PROGRAM SUPP 2011-14
long_description: The goal of the programme is more vibrant democracy and better electoral processes in Africa. The purpose is stronger and more effective democratic institutions in six African countries and at the regional and Pan-African level. Targeted actors/beneficiaries are RECs (EAC, SADC, ECOWAS, ECCAS) and -in selected countries- electoral management bodies, political parties, parliaments and CSO.

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

project_title: Civil Society and Governance Support / Appui à la gouvernance et à la société civile
short_description: CIVIL SOCIETY AND GOVERNANCE SUPPORT / APPUI À LA GOUVERNANCE ET À LA SOCIÉTÉ CIVILE
long_description: The goal of the project is to support the governance capacities of a select group of government, civil society and private sector institutions in an effort to ensure a responsible, equitable state that respects the rights of its citizens. Areas of support include: judicial administration, management of public funds, the electoral process, democratic development and ensuring basic human rights are upheld in Cameroon. As a result of this project the men and women of Cameroon are expected to be better informed as to their individual rights, to be more involved in their communities and able to actively improve their quality of life. / L'objectif du projet est d'appuyer les capacités en matière de gouvernance d'un groupe choisi d'organismes publics et privés et de la société civile, en vue d'encourager l'émergence d'un État responsable et équitable respectueux des droits de ses citoyens. Font l'objet d'un appui l'administration judiciaire, la gestion des fonds publics, le processus électoral, le développement démocratique et le respect des droits humains fondamentaux au Cameroun. Grâce à ce projet, les hommes et les femmes de ce pays connaissent mieux leurs droits individuels, s'impliquent davantage dans leur collectivité et sont mieux outillés pour travailler activement à l'amélioration de leur qualité de vie.

project_title: ELECTORAL PROCESSES
long_description: The project aims to support the conduct of transparent, free and fair elections and also ensure that the Electoral Management Bodies' (EMBs) infrastructure and capacity are developed

project_title: Voter registration in Sri Lanka
long_description: Inform the population about electoral register and support to fulfill the requirements for participation in elections

agency_name: Foreign Affairs and International Trade Canada
project_title: Vote in Peace and Voter Mobilization Project (Zimbabwe)
short_description: VOTE IN PEACE AND VOTER MOBILIZATION PROJECT (ZIMBABWE)
long_description: ZESN will address the issue of electoral participation in Zimbabwe through provincial and community awareness events, security training for community educators, and outreach events with the aim to increase gradually the number of youth and women who are registering and subsequently participating in upcoming elections. It is expected that as a result of this initiative, Zimbabwean citizens  in targeted regions and communities will become more aware of the need for non-violent campaigning and participation in electoral processes as well as of their electoral rights. In addition, the targeted audiences (with a focus on youth and women) will increase their knowledge of the registration processes and requirements and communities will have a greater ability to assert zero tolerance of politically motivated violence.

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

short_description: YOUTH VOTER REGISTRATION AND EDUCATION FORM
long_description: Youth Voter Registration and Education form

project_title: UNDP: Strengthening of the democratic process in Egypt
short_description: UNDP: STRENGTHENING OF THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS IN EGYPT
long_description: The UNDP programme has a double focus on (1) enhancing electoral procedures, in particular the establishment of an independent electoral management body (2) strengthening the capacity of young and female rural voters to exercise their right to vote. It has won the trust of Egyptian authorities and complements Switzerland's previous support for election observation which found that  although results were consistent with voters' intentions  further process improvements were required.

project_title: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators Electoral Activities
short_description: PACIFIC ISLANDS, AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND ELECTORAL ADMINISTRATORS ELECTORAL ACTIVITIES
long_description: The Pacific Partnership with Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) aims to enhance the capacity of electoral administrators and improve the governance and sustainability of electoral management bodies through training, development of strategic plans, upgrading of the Generic Voter Registration System database roll in Vanuatu and the establishment of a Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators (PIANZEA) website to provide members with a means to communicate and capture electoral issues and events. The total value of this initiative is $2.5 million over 3 years, starting 2011-12.

project_title: Citizen Voter List Monitoring - Ukraine Parliamentary Elections
short_description: CITIZEN VOTER LIST MONITORING - UKRAINE PARLIAMENTARY ELECTIONS
long_description: PROJECT BACKGROUND:In October 2012, Ukraine will conduct critical parliamentary elections which will determine the trajectory of the country for the foreseeable future. Because the parliamentary election law, heavily criticized by the Venice Commission for failing to create a level playing field for participating candidates and parties, failed to address adequately concerns about the transparency and administrative control of the national registry of voters, the Civil Initiative Support Center of Ukraine (CISC - www.cisc.org.ua) undertook a project in late 2011 to train Ukrainians to exercise their legal rights to obtain and confirm the accuracy of their personal information on the list. This project identified several areas of concern which, if unaddressed, will preclude a free and fair parliamentary election. With funding from the National Endowment for Democracy, and through technical support from the International Republican Institute (IRI), CISC initiated this voter registry project which targeted 174 of the 756 representative offices of the State Registry of Voters administrative bodies operating in Ukraine. This project resulted in 522 Ukrainian citizens sending official inquiries about their local voter lists to Regional Departments of the State Register of Voters and approximately 200 inquiries to the Central Electoral Committee. PURPOSE:Given the problems related to voter registry that were identified in its initial project, CISC proposes a second stage of the program to conduct activities seeking to increase the transparent and efficient work of administrative bodies of the State Registry while working to prevent the disenfranchisement of Ukrainian voters on election day. IRI will provide project management oversight and be DFAIT's direct project partner for this initiative, while also continuing to provide technical assistance to CISC.ACTIVITIES:- Dissemination of 175,000 informational brochures on 'Public access to the State Registry of Voters' - One national-level general training for all program participants including CISC coalition members. - Twenty-seven regional roundtables for information dissemination (one in each oblast and the capital).- Three thousand seven hundred and eighty inquiries to all 756 administrative bodies of the state register. - Questionnaires for the public on the efficiency and transparency of the work of the administrative bodies of the State Registry. - Official inquiries from Ukrainian voters to 378 administrative bodies of the state register of voters to gauge responsiveness prior to the election (about 50% of state registry departments). - The State Registry will be informed about the necessity of following Ukrainian legislation to respond to citizen's issues and concerns. - Continuous monitoring of the voter register and the eventual voter list. - Development of nationwide social network leveraging CISC's 3,000+ current activists and supporters and utilizing crowdsourcing technologies to map out and pu

project_title: Support to United Nations Development Programme for Bangladesh National Elections
short_description: SUPPORT TO UNITED NATIONS DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME FOR BANGLADESH NATIONAL ELECTIONS
long_description: Funding under this initiative provides support to the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) to deliver technical assistance to the Bangladesh Election Commission, specifically: online systems for results and candidate management; technical assistance to train staff on methodologies, training aids and materials; procurement of logistics including ballot boxes; and coordination of public debates for the candidates in 10 regions across the country. The total value of this initiative is $1.0 million to be expensed during the 2012-13 financial year.

long_description: The goal of the programme is more vibrant democracy and better electoral processes in Africa. The purpose is stronger and more effective democratic institutions in six African countries and at the regional and Pan-African level. Targeted actors/beneficiaries are RECs (EAC, SADC, ECOWAS, ECCAS) and -in selected countries- electoral management bodies, political parties, parliaments and CSO.

project_title: Support to the Electoral Process (STEP) program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE ELECTORAL PROCESS (STEP) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Since 2008, IFES has provided technical assistance to the Independent Election Commission (IEC) of Afghanistan through the Support to the Electoral Process in Afghanistan (STEP) project. This includes providing strategic advice and operational support to IEC departments in election administration, voter registration, electoral planning and operations, electoral security, public outreach, strategic planning, asset management, budgeting, human resource development, gender mainstreaming and on-the-spot assistance for jobs like translating documents.

project_title: Advancing Armenias Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIAS ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC).and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

project_title: Strengthening Afghan Civil Society  Free and Fair Elections Afghanistan
short_description: STRENGTHENING AFGHAN CIVIL SOCIETY  FREE AND FAIR ELECTIONS AFGHANISTAN
long_description: This project will seek to professionalize the leadership, build organizational capacity and administrative management of election-focused civil society organizations through specialized training and mentorship allowing these organizations to support the transparency and accountability of the electoral process in Afghanistan.Establish a foundation of well-managed, effective civil society organizations to advocate for transparency and accountability during upcoming elections.Provide civil society organizations with training and reference material on the best practices of NGO management.Strengthen the internal support functions of targeted civil society organizations, including finance, human resources, and administrative functions, allowing organizations to better fulfill their mandate. Improved capacity of Free and Fair Election Foundation Afghanistan (FEFA) staff through the provision of training and ongoing mentoring.Provide advice, mentorship and training on programming topics required by FEFA.

IFES support to building the NECs institutional and professional capacity will allow it to conduct elections with decreasing levels of international support.

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Training and Responsive Fund Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Composante formation et fonds réactif
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - TRAINING AND RESPONSIVE FUND COMPONENT / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - COMPOSANTE FORMATION ET FONDS RÉACTIF
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes. It includes technical and material support to the Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports local electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project includes activities implemented by civil society organizations in Haiti. In the past, technical support was provided by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes. For the elections anticipated in 2014, support will be provided through the National Democratic Institute to build capacity for local electoral observation and for women's political participation.   Canada is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - Technical Assistance Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total. / L'objectif du projet d'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux, notamment par l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation locale des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet vise la mise en place d'activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile en Haïti. Dans le passé, un appui technique a été fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haïtiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux. Pour les éléctions anticipée en 2014, un appui sera fourni par National Democratic Institute pour renforcer la capacité pour l'observation locale des éléctions et pour la participation des femmes au processus.   Le Canada appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Composante assistance technique. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.

project_title: Australia Indonesia Electoral Support Program
long_description: Australia Indonesia Electoral Support Program supports building a prosperous democratic and stable Indonesia. Indonesia's next election will take place in 2014 and approximately 300 sub-national local executive elections will take place between 2011 and 2013. Key objectives are to improve management of elections by electoral management bodies; and increased public engagement in the electoral process. The total value of this initiative is $22.8 million over 5 years, starting 2010-11.

project_title: Myanmar Australian Electoral Commission Visitation Program
short_description: MYANMAR AUSTRALIAN ELECTORAL COMMISSION VISITATION PROGRAM
long_description: The Myanmar-Australia Partnership for Reform aims to help strengthen democratic institutions, promote human rights and advance the rule of law, including supporting a free and fair election in 2015. The Partnership has three pillars targeting the development of the institutions central to Myanmar succeeding in reform and improved governance. Pillar 1: Institutions for effective delivery of public services, including support to strengthen public expenditure management, and to deliver a quality census. Pillar 2: institutions for conflict resolution and peace-building, including investing in community peace-building efforts and assistance that demonstrates the dividend from conflict resolution. Pillar 3: Institutions for an accountable and responsive state, including support to improve resource management and revenue transparency, elections and human rights. The total value of this initiative is $20.0 million over 3 years, starting 2012-13.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: EISA Electoral Institute of South.Africa
long_description: This project will build on experiences from a six year cooperation between EISA and SDC in building and strengthening the capacity of election stakeholders and the development and application of Election Management, Monitoring and Observation Principles (PEMMO) in the SADC Region. The overall objective of the programme is to contribute to the deepening of democracy by enhancing the capacity of election stakeholders, including Electoral Management bodies, SADC-ESN Civil Society Organisations and political parties, to manage, support and monitor elections in a sustainable manner in the SADC region.

project_title: EISA Mozambique elections 2013-2014
long_description: EISA is planning to support the transparency of the local (2013) and national (2014) elections in Mozambique through a two-year project. The project has three components: 1. Training on the new electoral laws, 2. Capacity development for political party monitoring of the elections, and 3. The electoral management body's ability to communicate and interact with all relevant stakeholders.

project_title: Support to the 2007 Elections in Kenya / Appui aux élections de 2007 au Kenya
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE 2007 ELECTIONS IN KENYA / APPUI AUX ÉLECTIONS DE 2007 AU KENYA
long_description: This project provided technical and financial assistance to national institutions such as the Electoral Commission of Kenya, civil society, media, human rights organizations, political parties, police and relevant security forces, that were critical to the achievement of free and fair elections. The project's main goals were: an independent assessment of the elections as free and fair; an increased voter turnout; a reduction in the number of spoiled votes; and very limited incidents of election-related violence.   Results as of March 2009 included: a 56% increase in registered voters, from 8,967,569 in 2002 to 16,096,180 in 2009; 447 journalists from 51 print and electronic media houses trained; media training manual for elections developed; 32 town hall debates on voter education organized in 8 provinces; and 48 civil society organizations selected to conduct voter education nationwide. / Ce projet a permis de fournir une assistance technique et financière aux institutions nationales comme la Commission électorale du Kenya, à la société civile, aux médias, aux organisations de défense des droits de la personne, aux partis politiques, aux forces policières et aux forces de sécurité pertinentes qui étaient essentielles à la tenue d'élections libres et justes. Les principaux objectifs du projet étaient : une évaluation indépendante pour attester que les élections étaient libres et justes; une participation électorale accrue; une réduction du nombre de votes annulés; un nombre très restreint de cas de violence liée aux élections.   Voici certains des résultats obtenus en date de mars 2009: une hausse de 56 % du nombre d'électeurs inscrits, qui est passé de 8 967 569 en 2002 à 16 096 180 en 2009; 447 journalistes de 51 centres de presse écrite et électronique ont reçus une formation; un manuel de formation destiné aux médias a été conçu pour les élections; 32 discussions ouvertes visant à sensibiliser les électeurs ont été organisées dans huit provinces; 48 organisations de la société civile ont été choisies pour mener des activités de sensibilisation des électeurs à l'échelle du pays.

The media will be strengthened in its role as watchdog and citizen informer to provide for impartial political reporting.

project_title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow (ELECT) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ENHANCING LEGAL AND ELECTORAL CAPACITY FOR TOMORROW (ELECT) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The ELECT project strengthens the ability of the Afghan government to conduct free and fair elections through technical support targeting Independent Elections Commission (IEC). Main objectives of the project are ongoing institutional strengthening of the IEC, exploring ways to improve voter registration and focusing on civic and voter education. Assistance to the IEC is provided in the form of Technical Advisors, who are working in partnership with their Afghan counterparts from the IEC. These advisors are not expected to take a lead in electoral administration decision making, but rather provide specialized and targeted support to the various IEC departments heads enhancing their preparations for the future round of elections. In partnership with other donor countries, USAID support to the IEC through the UNDP ELECT basket fund will help Afghan government deliver free, fair and credible elections with results that are broadly accepted by majority of Afghan people.

project_title: Sudan Election Administration Support Program (SEASP) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUDAN ELECTION ADMINISTRATION SUPPORT PROGRAM (SEASP) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of this task order will be to support technically sound administration of historic Sudanese electoral processes called for in the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) through: 1) Strengthening the capacity of election management bodies in Sudan to administer credible elections and referenda; and 2) Providing election-related commodities needed to ensure the success of these key political processes.

project_title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kenya
long_description: Election observation is defined as the purposeful gathering of information regarding an electoral process and making informed judgements about the process on the basis of information collected. Over the years election observation in Kenya has largely focused on Election Day processes and activities an approach that fails to take into cognizance the environment and processes prior to and after the elections. ELOG has organized itself as a comprehensive election monitoring and observation programme. Its aim is to promote trasparency and accountability in the lectoral processes in Kenya and the Africa Region. Taking elections as a process and not an event ELOG has identified seven key thematic issues under which thematic monitoring and observation shall be anchored namely: voter registration monitoring and implenetation of political parties Act and political financing advocacy on electoral law reform and constituency delimitation campaign monitoring promotion and participation of marginalized groups voter education and media monitoring. This is anticipated to set a comprehensive background and environment for actual election-day monittoring and observation which will utize the traditional observation and parallel vote tabulation methodologies for purposes of deterring electoral malpractices and the swift verification of the official results and the credibility of the election-day processesObjectives; to enhance stakeholder awareness on the electoral process undertake comprehensive thematic monitoring and observation of electora process leading to and after the 2012 elections to faciliate the stablishment and build capacity for a peace panel to undertake election day observation through fielding general observers and parallel vote tabulation observers

project_title: Support to Tanzania's Parliament and Electoral Management bodies
short_description: SUPPORT TO TANZANIA'S PARLIAMENT AND ELECTORAL MANAGEMENT BODIES
long_description: To provide support in strengthening Tanzania's key democratic institutions of Parliament, constitution and elections through enhanced organisational capacity and effective citizen participation by 2015.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Institute Panos Caraibes
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO INSTITUTE PANOS CARAIBES
long_description: To conduct a journalistic investigation into the process of voter registration in Haiti and to debate the challenges, lessons learned and impacts of the process on the upcoming local elections. Institute Panos will conduct interviews with former and current representatives of governmental bodies that play a role in voter registration, citizens who have successful and unsuccessfully registered, political party representatives, and civil society organizations and will promote its findings via radio broadcasts, a press release and major media outlets.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Rassemblement des Citoyens Organises de la Grand Anse
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO RASSEMBLEMENT DES CITOYENS ORGANISES DE LA GRAND ANSE
long_description: Supplement to a grant approved in FY 2012 ($37,000). To provide voter education, particular to women and youth, in anticipation of upcoming local and legislative elections. RACOGA will engage youth of voting age across ten communities In the Grand Anse department to further their knowledge of elections, voter registration, and the responsibilities of elected authorities. RACOGA will continue working with local community assemblies and arrange a series of community forums where the assemblies will present their community development priorities to Senatorial and mayoral candidates, as well as candidates for local city councils.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Cooperation Center for Afghanistan
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO COOPERATION CENTER FOR AFGHANISTAN
long_description: To engage and enhance civil society organizations  capacity to monitor elections and limit electoral fraud and mismanagement. CCA will train local civil society organizations in central Afghanistan s Bamyan and Daikundi provinces on best practices in election monitoring for the 2014 presidential and provincial council elections.

project_title: Pakistan Electoral System Support / Appui au système électoral du Pakistan
short_description: PAKISTAN ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT / APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU PAKISTAN
long_description: This project aims to strengthen the management ability of the Election Commission of Pakistan and increase the participation of voters in Pakistan's political system. More specifically, it seeks to improve the credibility of the country's election system and increase voter registration and turnout. The project supports the Election Commission's five-year strategic plan by providing technical expertise and training on all aspects of election management. It focuses on engaging youth and promoting the rights of women and minorities to ensure their representation in the democratic process.   The project is implemented by the International Foundation for Electoral Systems in cooperation with local civil society organizations. / Ce projet vise à renforcer la capacité de gestion de la Commission électorale du Pakistan et à accroître la participation des électeurs dans le système politique du Pakistan. Plus particulièrement, il vise à améliorer la crédibilité du système électoral du pays et à augmenter l'inscription des électeurs et le taux de participation électorale. Le projet appuie le plan stratégique de cinq ans de la Commission électorale en fournissant une expertise technique et de la formation sur tous les aspects de la gestion des élections. Il met l'accent sur l'engagement des jeunes et la promotion des droits des femmes et des minorités afin d'assurer leur représentation dans le processus démocratique.   Le projet est mis en uvre par l'International Foundation for Electoral Systems en collaboration avec des organisations locales de la société civile.

project_title: Implementation Phase
long_description: To strengthen the capacity of the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) so that it is able to help ensure effective and well organised Afghan-led elections in 2014/15, to improve the voter registration system in order to increase public confidence in ele

project_title: Strengthening Election Management in Bangladesh (SEMB)
long_description: The project will strengthen democracy in Bangladesh and consolidate & reinforce the electoral reform process set in motion since the 2008 elections by enhancing the capacity of the Bangladesh Election Commission in its current transitional phase to organise and supervise credible elections at all levels to international standards throughout the electoral cycle.

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

project_title: EMAS Support to International Federation For Electoral Support
short_description: EMAS SUPPORT TO INTERNATIONAL FEDERATION FOR ELECTORAL SUPPORT
long_description: Election management, conflict and security institutions deliver transparent, inclusive elections, manage most disputes peacefully and reduce scale should violence occur

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

project_title: Sudan Election Administration Support Program (SEASP) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUDAN ELECTION ADMINISTRATION SUPPORT PROGRAM (SEASP) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of this task order will be to support technically sound administration of historic Sudanese electoral processes called for in the Comprehensive Peace Agreement (CPA) through: 1) Strengthening the capacity of election management bodies in Sudan to administer credible elections and referenda; and 2) Providing election-related commodities needed to ensure the success of these key political processes.

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

project_title: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The aim of this Building Sustainable Election Management in Liberia project is to increase the capacity of the NEC to efficiently, effectively, and impartially manage the upcoming elections. IFES support to building the NECs institutional and professional capacity will allow it to conduct elections with decreasing levels of international support.

project_title: Elections and Political Processes - Election Management
short_description: ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES - ELECTION MANAGEMENT
long_description: Elections and Political Processes - Support electoral management bodies to conduct elections, formal adjudication of electoral disputes, and security for elections.

project_title: Enhancing Legal and Electoral Capacity for Tomorrow (ELECT) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ENHANCING LEGAL AND ELECTORAL CAPACITY FOR TOMORROW (ELECT) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The ELECT project strengthens the ability of the Afghan government to conduct free and fair elections through technical support targeting Independent Elections Commission (IEC). Main objectives of the project are ongoing institutional strengthening of the IEC, exploring ways to improve voter registration and focusing on civic and voter education. Assistance to the IEC is provided in the form of Technical Advisors, who are working in partnership with their Afghan counterparts from the IEC. These advisors are not expected to take a lead in electoral administration decision making, but rather provide specialized and targeted support to the various IEC departments heads enhancing their preparations for the future round of elections. In partnership with other donor countries, USAID support to the IEC through the UNDP ELECT basket fund will help Afghan government deliver free, fair and credible elections with results that are broadly accepted by majority of Afghan people.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: UNDP: Strengthening of the democratic process in Egypt
short_description: UNDP: STRENGTHENING OF THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS IN EGYPT
long_description: The UNDP programme has a double focus on (1) enhancing electoral procedures, in particular the establishment of an independent electoral management body (2) strengthening the capacity of young and female rural voters to exercise their right to vote. It has won the trust of Egyptian authorities and complements Switzerland's previous support for election observation which found that  although results were consistent with voters' intentions  further process improvements were required.

project_title: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators: Electoral Activities
short_description: PACIFIC ISLANDS, AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND ELECTORAL ADMINISTRATORS: ELECTORAL ACTIVITIES
long_description: The Pacific Partnership with Australian Electoral Commission (AEC) aims to enhance the capacity of electoral administrators and improve the governance and sustainability of electoral management bodies through training, development of strategic plans, upgrading of the Generic Voter Registration System database roll in Vanuatu and the establishment of a Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators (PIANZEA) website to provide members with a means to communicate and capture electoral issues and events. The total value of this initiative is $2.5 million over 3 years, starting 2011-12.

project_title: Kenya Electoral System Support / Appui au système électoral du Kenya
short_description: KENYA ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT / APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU KENYA
long_description: This initiative seeks to reduce the barriers that prevented the participation of 45.7% of the eligible voting population in the 2007 elections by implementing a civic and voter education program. The project also focuses on improving voter registration and identification systems. The goal is to ensure the accuracy, credibility and representativeness of the voters  roll so that previously disadvantaged groups, such as women and youth, are included.   Some project activities include: (i) conducting focus groups and stakeholder consultations in five pilot constituencies to collect information on low voter turnout, particularly among women and youth; (ii) implementing a civic and voter education program in up to five pilot constituencies, with help from Elections Canada, and scaling the program up to the national level; (iii) working with Kenya s Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) and the National Registration Bureau (NRB) to establish a protocol for sharing national citizen registration and voter registration data between the two organizations to capture the necessary voter registration information; and (iv) supporting Kenya s IEBC to develop and implement a strategy for the sustainable, reliable and credible use of election technology, in particular, biometric voter registration kits. / Cette initiative vise à aplanir les obstacles en raison desquels 45,7 % des personnes ayant le droit de vote n ont pas participé aux élections de 2007, plus précisément par la mise en oeuvre d un programme d éducation civique des électeurs. Elle met également l accent sur l amélioration des systèmes d inscription et d identification des électeurs. Le but est de faire en sorte que les registres électoraux soient exacts, crédibles et représentatifs, de façon à assurer la participation des groupes autrefois désavantagés, dont les femmes et les jeunes.   Parmi les activités de l initiative : i) tenir des groupes de discussion et des consultations auprès des intervenants dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes pour recueillir des renseignements sur le faible taux de participation aux élections, en particulier chez les femmes et les jeunes; ii) mettre en oeuvre un programme d éducation civique des électeurs dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes au maximum, avec l aide d Élections Canada, et déployer le programme à l échelle nationale; iii) collaborer avec la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions et le Bureau national de l enregistrement du Kenya à l établissement d un protocole de mise en commun des données nationales d enregistrement des citoyens et d inscription des électeurs par ces deux organismes, dans le but de consigner les renseignements nécessaires pour l inscription des électeurs; iv) aider la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions du Kenya à élaborer et à mettre en oeuvre une stratégie visant l utilisation durable, fiable et crédible de la technologie électorale, en par

project_title: Advancing Democracy through a Strong and Inclusive Electoral Process / Faire avancer la démocratie au moyen d un processus électoral solide et inclusi
short_description: ADVANCING DEMOCRACY THROUGH A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE ELECTORAL PROCESS / FAIRE AVANCER LA DÉMOCRATIE AU MOYEN D UN PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL SOLIDE ET INCLUSI
long_description: The project aims to increase the credibility and effectiveness of the 2014 and 2019 legislative and presidential elections in Indonesia, indirectly benefitting at least 186 million registered voters. It seeks to strengthen the legal framework and the ability of Indonesia election authorities to administer future elections, reduce election-related violence and increase the participation of women, youth and marginalized groups in the electoral process. The project is working with local partners to provide technical assistance where it is most needed for the July 2014 presidential election, and possible September 2014 runoff election. It is then capturing lessons learned to integrate these into the next election cycle (2014-2019), most importantly into the new legislature s deliberations on the fundamental electoral legal framework reform.   Project activities are implemented countrywide with a special focus on areas of greatest risk for contested or violent elections, such as Aceh and Eastern Indonesia. Some project activities include: (1) providing technical assistance to legislators on how to prepare reforms to elections laws; (2) providing technical assistance to the election commission for the development of a five-year strategic plan (based on lessons learned from the 2014 election); (3) assisting the election commission with upgrades to key systems and databases such as the voter registration list; (4) collecting and analyzing information on election-related violence to assist national and regional election officials in preventing further flare-ups; (5) training elections personnel, including poll station workers, on election administration; (6) developing voter education campaigns and social media tools to inform the electorate (in particular youth, women and marginalized groups) about voting rights, the process and the importance of participation; and (7) training women and conduct advocacy campaigns to increase the number of women in the electoral commissions. / Le projet vise à accroître la crédibilité et l efficacité des élections nationales de 2014 et de 2019 en Indonésie, dont profiteront au plus 186 millions d électeurs inscrits. Il vise à renforcer le cadre juridique et la capacité des pouvoirs électoraux en Indonésie pour administrer les prochaines élections, réduire la violence liée aux élections et accroître la participation des femmes, des jeunes et des groupes marginalisés au processus électoral. Dans le cadre de ce projet, les responsables travaillent de concert avec des partenaires locaux pour fournir une assistance technique là oÃ¹ elle est le plus nécessaire pour l élection présidentielle de juillet 2014, et possiblement pour le deuxième tour en septembre 2014. Le projet compile les leçons tirées pour les intégrer au prochain cycle électoral (2014-2019) et, surtout, aux délibérations de la nouvelle assemblée législative sur la réforme du cadre juridique de base des élections.   Les activités du projet sont mises en oeuvre à

long_description: The Fiji Transition to Democracy initiative aims to: support Fiji Elections Office to help conduct a national voter registration exercise as part of the introduction of electronic voter registration; support to the Constitution Commission; and support for civic education by working with the United Nations Development Program to implement a national civic education program with civil society and government. The total value of this initiative is $5.6 million over 3 years, starting 2012-13.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: Support to Tanzania's Election Cycle 2013  2016 (STEC 13-16)
long_description: The proposed intervention supports the Tanzanian Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and the media in Tanzania for the Constitutional referendum 2014 and local and general elections in 2014/2015. EMBs will be supported for institutional reforms and capacity strengthening to guarantee free and credible elections. The media will be strengthened in its role as watchdog and citizen informer to provide for impartial political reporting.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: Support to Tanzania's Election Cycle 2013  2016 (STEC 13-16)
long_description: The proposed intervention supports the Tanzanian Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and the media in Tanzania for the Constitutional referendum 2014 and local and general elections in 2014/2015. EMBs will be supported for institutional reforms and capacity strengthening to guarantee free and credible elections. The media will be strengthened in its role as watchdog and citizen informer to provide for impartial political reporting.

project_title: Strengthening Democratic Actors in Afghanistan
long_description: This project will seek to professionalize the leadership, build organizational capacity and administrative management of election-focused civil society organizations through specialized training and mentorship allowing these organizations to support the transparency and accountability of the electoral process in Afghanistan.â¢Establish a foundation of well-managed, effective civil society organizations to advocate for transparency and accountability during upcoming elections.â¢Provide civil society organizations with training and reference material on the best practices of NGO management.â¢Strengthen the internal support functions of targeted civil society organizations, including finance, human resources, and administrative functions, allowing organizations to better fulfill their mandate.
