project_title: Australian Civilian Corps Fiji Elections Support
short_description: AUSTRALIAN CIVILIAN CORPS FIJI ELECTIONS SUPPORT
long_description: The Australian Civilian Corps (ACC) is a whole of government initiative that deploys civilian specialists to countries experiencing or emerging from natural disaster or conflict, specifically to support stabilisation, recovery and development training. Funding under this initiative supports the deployment of ACC specialists to Fiji to assist in establishing electronic voter registration and conduct capacity assessments and operations planning. The total value of this initiative is $0.3 million over 2 years, starting 2013-14.

project_title: SUPPORT TO NIGERIA S ELECTORAL CYCLE (2011-2015) II
short_description: SUPPORT TO NIGERIA S ELECTORAL CYCLE (2011-2015) II
long_description: The project aims to develop the capacity of the electoral management body to deliver peaceful, acceptable and credible elections and to strengthen stakeholder capacity to engage in electoral processes in an informed and sustainable manner.The need to scale up activities, fill identified funding gaps, and sustain momentum in the run up to the 2015 General Elections provides a justification for this project. It is intended that this project (funded through the bridging facility) will be approved b

project_title: EU ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO NIGERIA ELECTORAL CYCLE 2011-2015
short_description: EU ADDITIONAL SUPPORT TO NIGERIA ELECTORAL CYCLE 2011-2015
long_description: The project aims to develop the capacity of the electoral management body to deliver peaceful, acceptable and credible elections and to strengthen stakeholder capacity to engage in electoral processes in an informed and sustainable manner.The need to scale up activities, fill identified funding gaps, and sustain momentum in the run up to the 2015 General Elections provides a justification for this project.

project_title: Conference and General Assembly Meeting of the Association of European Electoral Officials (ACEEEO)
short_description: CONFERENCE AND GENERAL ASSEMBLY MEETING OF THE ASSOCIATION OF EUROPEAN ELECTORAL OFFICIALS (ACEEEO)
long_description: The 23rd Annual Conference and General Assembly Meeting of the Association of European Electoral Officials (ACEEEO) organized on 4-6 September, 2014 in Bucharest by the Permanent Electoral AuthorityThe topic of the conference was 'Participation of Women in Electoral Process and Public Life' and 'Planning of a General Election'.PARTICIPATION OF WOMEN IN ELECTORAL PROCESS AND PUBLIC LIFE'Although the suffrage of women has been recognized worldwide in the 20th century, and the most important international and regional human rights documents declare that right to vote, right to stand for the election and right to take part in public life should be ensured to women on equal terms, this group of the society face discrimination also in our days.The main field of this discrimination is the taking part in the work of the Parliament and other directly elected representative bodies. According to the last published OSCE results, in the OSCE region the portion of women representatives in the lower chambers is 24,4%. However, more and more countries introduce legal means to increase legal participation in politics like for example quotas or similar rules. The first step for the development in this field is identifying discriminatory laws, policies and practices, and the 23rd Annual Conference of ACEEEO will give an opportunity for that as well as getting familiar with best practices.Right to vote of women should also be ensured without discrimination and electoral management bodies play a crucial rule also in this field when preparing an electoral process, informing voters, organising trainings for the lower-level electoral management bodies and poll workers. Finally, it is also inevitable to have women in the electoral bodies and in other election-related organisations.The above mentioned development can be conducted only with a strong cooperation among the law-making bodies, electoral management bodies, women rights non-governmental organisations, political parties and other electoral stakeholders.II. 'PLANNING OF A GENERAL ELECTION'General elections are certainly the most complex project that a state organ should implement in a country. In a relatively short period the electoral management bodies have to plan, operate and monitor plenty of different activities from the boundary delimitation, voter registration, establishing the polling committees, election training, voter education, registration of candidates, setting up the polling stations, ensuring the condition for a legal, safe casting of votes till the vote counting, results transmission and handling legal remedies.During the whole process, legal, administrative, logistical, IT, financial and communicational tasks are conducted simultaneously. The basis for this is the accurate, careful and detailed planning.What are the best methods for the planning? Can the usual means, approaches, definitions of general project management used also for this form of planning? How can IT operations support this plann

project_title: Support to Building Institutional Capacities of the Electoral Management Bodies in the Romanian ODA priority countries
short_description: SUPPORT TO BUILDING INSTITUTIONAL CAPACITIES OF THE ELECTORAL MANAGEMENT BODIES IN THE ROMANIAN ODA PRIORITY COUNTRIES
long_description: The overall objective of this project is to support the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and other key stakeholders involved in the electoral process (including  elected political representatives, civil society and media representatives) in the partner countries of Romania's official development assistance (ODA) programme in building their institutional capacities to organize independent, free and fair elections. The project will facilitate the exchange of experience in electoral assistance field between Romania (and for a number of selected activities Mexico) and the ODA partner countries through a number of seminars, work visits and electoral observation missions.

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Training and Responsive Fund Component / Appui à la transition électorale - Volet sur la formation et les fonds de sout
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - TRAINING AND RESPONSIVE FUND COMPONENT / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - VOLET SUR LA FORMATION ET LES FONDS DE SOUT
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support project is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes. It includes technical and material support to the Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports local electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   This component of the project includes activities implemented by civil society organizations in Haiti. In the past, technical support was provided by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes. For the next elections, support will be provided through the National Democratic Institute to build capacity for local electoral observation and for women s political participation.   Canada is also supporting the Electoral Transition Support - Technical Assistance Component. The two project components are valued at $19.5 million in total. / L objectif du projet d Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti. Il appuie l organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux, notamment par l appui en termes d assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral et des autres structures nationales électorales clés et un fonds réactif qui permet d entreprendre l observation locale des processus électoraux et d appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haïtienne afin d encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Ce volet du projet vise la mise en place d activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile en Haïti. Dans le passé, un appui technique a été fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haïtiennes dans l organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux. Pour les prochaines éléctions, un appui sera fourni par National Democratic Institute pour renforcer la capacité pour l observation locale des éléctions et pour la participation des femmes au processus.   Le Canada appuie également le volet Appui à la transition électorale - Composante assistance technique. Les deux volets du projet ont une valeur totale de 19,5 millions de dollars.

project_title: Workshop Series for Election Management Bodies on  Conflict Sensitive Election Management
short_description: WORKSHOP SERIES FOR ELECTION MANAGEMENT BODIES ON  CONFLICT SENSITIVE ELECTION MANAGEMENT
long_description: The Workshop  on Conflict Sensitive Election Management  will provide electoral authorities with an overview of practical measures and activities to prevent and mitigate election related violence. It will support the authorities to develop internal strategy in electoral security administration and mediation of electoral conflicts. The workshop will take place in countries where elections are scheduled over the next two years (e.g.: Burundi) and is a joint cooperation between the Government of Switzerland, Swisspeace and Creative Associates International.

project_title: Follow-up roundtables on Election Observation in Egypt
short_description: FOLLOW-UP ROUNDTABLES ON ELECTION OBSERVATION IN EGYPT
long_description: At the request of the Egyptian Authorities, this project responds to the need for dialogue between the Higher Election Commission (HEC) of Egypt and the Egyptian civil society active in election observation. The series of follow-up roundtables on Domestic Election Observation in Egypt will facilitate the exchanges among the two actors, to solve immediate and medium-term issues in accreditation and exchanges. The first Follow-up Roundtable will in particular address questions related to accreditation in the upcoming parliamentary elections and the modalities of a liaison platform. The project also aims at supporting the ad-hoc electoral commission to prepare for a future permanent electoral management body.

project_title: Improving Moldovan democracy through electoral and parliamentary support
short_description: IMPROVING MOLDOVAN DEMOCRACY THROUGH ELECTORAL AND PARLIAMENTARY SUPPORT
long_description: The program supports the Central Electoral Commission to increase citizens' trust in the electoral processes and their outcomes.  The program supports insttutional strengthening and voter registration process and incorporates cross-cutting human rights and gender issues.

long_description: Organization and Management of Elections enhanced

long_description: Capacity strengthening of election management authority

project_title: Support to Tanzania's Parliament and Electoral Management bodies
short_description: SUPPORT TO TANZANIA'S PARLIAMENT AND ELECTORAL MANAGEMENT BODIES
long_description: To provide support in strengthening Tanzania's key democratic institutions of Parliament, constitution and elections through enhanced organisational capacity and effective citizen participation by 2015.

project_title: Kyrgyz Election Support Project (UNDP)
long_description: UNDP-Support Project Kyrgyz Elections Support Project (KESP) - Voter Registration Software Development

project_title: Support to the Electoral Process (STEP) program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE ELECTORAL PROCESS (STEP) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Since 2008, IFES has provided technical assistance to the Independent Election Commission (IEC) of Afghanistan through the Support to the Electoral Process in Afghanistan (STEP) project. This includes providing strategic advice and operational support to IEC departments in election administration, voter registration, electoral planning and operations, electoral security, public outreach, strategic planning, asset management, budgeting, human resource development, gender mainstreaming and on-the-spot assistance for jobs like translating documents.

project_title: EISA, Africa Democracy Strengthening Program, II                                                    Strengthening Programme Phase II - Africa Democracy Strengthening Program, II
short_description: EISA, AFRICA DEMOCRACY STRENGTHENING PROGRAM, II                                                    STRENGTHENING PROGRAMME PHASE II - AFRICA DEMOCRA
long_description: The goal of the programme is more vibrant democracy and better        electoral processes in Africa. The purpose is stronger and more       effective democratic institutions in six African countries and at the regional and Pan-African level. Targeted actors/beneficiaries are     RECs (EAC, SADC, ECOWAS, ECCAS) and -in selected countries- electoral management bodies, political parties, parliaments and CSO.

project_title: Strengthening the Electoral Process and Democracy / Renforcement de la démocratie et du système électoral
short_description: STRENGTHENING THE ELECTORAL PROCESS AND DEMOCRACY / RENFORCEMENT DE LA DÉMOCRATIE ET DU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL
long_description: This project aims to strengthen democratic electoral processes in the lead-up to the constitutional referendum (2014) and the general elections (2015). The project aims to increase the effectiveness of election management bodies and other key democratic institutions, increase civic participation and engagement in political and electoral processes, and prevent election-related conflict. Strengthened electoral processes lead to an enhanced democratic environment, economic growth, and stability in Tanzania.   Some project activities include: (i) supporting the National Electoral Commission in updating election regulations and guidelines; (ii) supporting dialogue between the electoral management bodies, civil society organizations, media and political parties to improve the legal and institutional framework for democratic and inclusive elections in Tanzania; (iii) supporting skills and capacity development for women, youth and people with disabilities as potential candidates and party leaders; (iv) promoting public awareness on gender equality and women s empowerment through community dialogue and voter education; and (v) providing human rights and gender awareness training for the police. / Ce projet vise à renforcer les processus électoraux démocratiques en prévision du référendum constitutionnel (2014) et des élections générales qui suivront (2015). Il vise également à améliorer l efficacité des organismes chargés de gérer les élections et d autres institutions démocratiques clés, à accroître la participation et la mobilisation civiques à l égard des processus politiques et électoraux ainsi qu à prévenir les conflits liés aux élections. Le renforcement des processus électoraux se traduit par une amélioration de l environnement démocratique, de la croissance économique et de la stabilité en Tanzanie.   Quelques activités du projet incluent : i) aider la Commission électorale nationale à mettre à jour les directives et les règlements relatifs aux élections; ii) stimuler le dialogue entre les organismes chargés de gérer les élections, les organisations de la société civile, les médias et les partis politiques afin d améliorer le cadre juridique et institutionnel en vue d assurer un processus électoral démocratique et inclusif en Tanzanie; iii) encourager le développement de compétences et de capacités chez les femmes, les jeunes et les personnes atteintes d une incapacité en tant que candidats et chefs de partis potentiels; iv) sensibiliser le public à l égalité des sexes et à l autonomisation des femmes à travers le dialogue communautaire et l éducation des électeurs; v) fournir aux membres des forces policières une formation de sensibilisation aux droits de la personne et aux différences entre les sexes.

long_description: Registered voters are empowered to make informed choices and exercise their democratic rights to vote within a safe and unbiased electoral environment.

project_title: EISA Mozambique elections 2013-2014

Training on the new electoral    laws, 2. Capacity development for political party monitoring of the   elections, and 3. The electoral management body's ability to          communicate and interact with all relevant stakeholders.

project_title: Pakistan Electoral System Support / Appui au système électoral du Pakistan
short_description: PAKISTAN ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT / APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU PAKISTAN
long_description: This project aims to strengthen the management ability of the Election Commission of Pakistan and increase the participation of voters in Pakistan s political system. More specifically, it seeks to improve the credibility of the country s election system and increase voter registration and turnout. The project supports the Election Commission s five-year strategic plan by providing technical expertise and training on all aspects of election management. It focuses on engaging youth and promoting the rights of women and minorities to ensure their representation in the democratic process.   The project is implemented by the International Foundation for Electoral Systems in cooperation with local civil society organizations. / Ce projet vise à renforcer la capacité de gestion de la Commission électorale du Pakistan et à accroître la participation des électeurs dans le système politique du Pakistan. Plus particulièrement, il vise à améliorer la crédibilité du système électoral du pays et à augmenter l inscription des électeurs et le taux de participation électorale. Le projet appuie le plan stratégique de cinq ans de la Commission électorale en fournissant une expertise technique et de la formation sur tous les aspects de la gestion des élections. Il met l accent sur l engagement des jeunes et la promotion des droits des femmes et des minorités afin d assurer leur représentation dans le processus démocratique.   Le projet est mis en oeuvre par l International Foundation for Electoral Systems en collaboration avec des organisations locales de la société civile.

long_description: This project focuses on sustaining credible elections, building peace and national cohesion in Ghana before, during and after the 2012 general elections. It offers contextual analyses of Ghana's December 2012 presidential and parliamentary elections, highlights Ghana's experience of elections management and the associated cyclical risks and particularly proposes actions to mitigate or address new or emergent threats.

project_title: Workshop Series for Election Management Bodies on  Conflict Sensitive Election Management

long_description: The Workshop  on Conflict Sensitive Election Management  will provide electoral authorities with an overview of practical measures and activities to prevent and mitigate election related violence. It will support the authorities to develop internal strategy in electoral security administration and mediation of electoral conflicts. The workshop will take place in countries where elections are scheduled over the next two years (e.g.: Burundi) and is a joint cooperation between the government of Switzerland, Swisspeace and Creative Associates International.

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

project_title: Kyrgyzstan Political Process Program III - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: KYRGYZSTAN POLITICAL PROCESS PROGRAM III - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The goal of this program is to help the Kyrgyz Republic further consolidate its democracy through strengthening the responsiveness and sustainability of political institutions - specifically political parties, elected parliamentary representatives, and election administration bodies. FY 2014 funds will be used to support the countrys preparation for fall 2015 Parliamentary elections through training for political parties, civic education on election-related rights and obligations, support to the Central Election Commission and other electoral management bodies, and improved mechanisms for communication between elected officials and citizens.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to National Democratic Institute for International Affairs (NDI)
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO NATIONAL DEMOCRATIC INSTITUTE FOR INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS (NDI)
long_description: To promote shared norms and principles of electoral integrity and build capacity among members of the Global Network of Domestic Election Monitors. The program will facilitate targeted exchanges and promote dialogue on challenges to electoral integrity among civil society groups, international organizations, and election management bodies.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to West Africa Network for Peace Building
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO WEST AFRICA NETWORK FOR PEACE BUILDING
long_description: To mitigate and reduce electoral violence as well as increase voter turnout for the 2015 presidential elections, the West African Network for Peacebuilding in Cte dIvoire (WANEP) will train 60 youth leaders to conduct a campaign on citizen participation in the electoral process and the peaceful management and prevention of electoral conflicts.  The youth will also monitor political violence.  The trained youth will conduct a second awareness campaign right before the presidential elections to educate the population on how to address electoral complaints.  WANEP will also conduct a get-out-the-vote campaign and 16 radio shows before the presidential elections.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Association pour des Reseaux Educatifs et Culturels Francophones
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO ASSOCIATION POUR DES RESEAUX EDUCATIFS ET CULTURELS FRANCOPHONES
long_description: To consolidate peace and democracy in Western Cte dIvoire ahead of the 2015 presidential elections, the Association pour des Rseaux Educatifs et Culturels Francophones (AREFCI) will train 25 canton chiefs on human rights and elections, gender, democratic processes, and the prevention and resolution of conflict. The chiefs will devise a common strategy to prevent electoral violence in Western Cte dIvoire.  AREFCI will then hold a seminar for 45 village chiefs coming from the ten regions of Western Cte dIvoire. The 25 canton chiefs trained earlier will share their knowledge with the village chiefs and discuss ways to combine traditional methods of conflict prevention with community mobilization techniques. AREFCI will finally conduct a 20-day civic awareness campaign, led by the chiefs, to inform 20,000 citizens on the electoral process and encourage them to register and vote.

project_title: Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education Program (VOICE) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: VOTER OPINION AND INVOLVEMENT THROUGH CIVIC EDUCATION PROGRAM (VOICE) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The Voter Opinion and Involvement through Civic Education (VOICE) project to improve the capacity of citizens to participate in decentralization and electoral processes. The project reaches underrepresented populations to encourage engagement with broader society, particularly in political participation. IFES initiatives include projects in voter registration, public awareness campaigns, capacity building for local organizations and efforts to motivate vulnerable and marginalized populations to be actively involved in their governance.

project_title: Strengthening the independence of election management bodies
short_description: STRENGTHENING THE INDEPENDENCE OF ELECTION MANAGEMENT BODIES
long_description: The project s goals were the transfer of good practices and exchange of experience for 20 participants (representatives of the central election commission, political parties, NGOs involved in elections, experts in election processes and members of the parliamentary commission for legislation). During a 2-day workshop in the first quarter of the year and a 1-day workshop in the third quarter, Slovenian representatives shared their know-how and good practices, above all stressing the importance of the central election commission s independence. The project aims to support the reform processes in Albania s election legislation, in line with the OSCE recommendations and this year s conference findings on Albania s election legislation reform. The workshop aims to contribute in sharing experiences and best practices between Albania and Slovenia. Also local elections were analysed as well as how to increase the independence of Election Management Bodies. Discussed topics:- Different election management models (comparison between the Albanian and Slovenian models) and their impact on the independence of election management bodies.- Influence of the election framework, political and social expectations, and cultural environment.- Level of political commitments facilitating the independent and impartial functioning of the Central Election Commission  level of political parties  participation in the National Electoral Commission s day-to-day activities.- Possible forms of cooperation between election management bodies, political parties and other stakeholders (e.g. NGOs).- Election management bodies  terms of reference. - Election management bodies  internal rules and procedures (minimising the influence of political parties). - Qualifications needed for appointment to election management bodies and appointment procedure.

project_title: Kenya Electoral System Support / Appui au système électoral du Kenya
short_description: KENYA ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT / APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU KENYA
long_description: This initiative seeks to reduce the barriers that prevented the participation of 45.7% of the eligible voting population in the 2007 elections by implementing a civic and voter education program. The project also focuses on improving voter registration and identification systems. The goal is to ensure the accuracy, credibility and representativeness of the voters' roll so that previously disadvantaged groups, such as women and youth, are included.   Some project activities include: (i) conducting focus groups and stakeholder consultations in five pilot constituencies to collect information on low voter turnout, particularly among women and youth; (ii) implementing a civic and voter education program in up to five pilot constituencies, with help from Elections Canada, and scaling the program up to the national level; (iii) working with Kenya's Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) and the National Registration Bureau (NRB) to establish a protocol for sharing national citizen registration and voter registration data between the two organizations to capture the necessary voter registration information; and (iv) supporting Kenya's IEBC to develop and implement a strategy for the sustainable, reliable and credible use of election technology, in particular, biometric voter registration kits. / Cette initiative vise à aplanir les obstacles en raison desquels 45,7 % des personnes ayant le droit de vote n'ont pas participé aux élections de 2007, plus précisément par la mise en oeuvre d'un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs. Elle met également l'accent sur l'amélioration des systèmes d'inscription et d'identification des électeurs. Le but est de faire en sorte que les registres électoraux soient exacts, crédibles et représentatifs, de façon à assurer la participation des groupes autrefois désavantagés, dont les femmes et les jeunes.   Parmi les activités de l'initiative : i) tenir des groupes de discussion et des consultations auprès des intervenants dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes pour recueillir des renseignements sur le faible taux de participation aux élections, en particulier chez les femmes et les jeunes; ii) mettre en oeuvre un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes au maximum, avec l'aide d'Élections Canada, et déployer le programme à l'échelle nationale; iii) collaborer avec la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions et le Bureau national de l'enregistrement du Kenya à l'établissement d'un protocole de mise en commun des données nationales d'enregistrement des citoyens et d'inscription des électeurs par ces deux organismes, dans le but de consigner les renseignements nécessaires pour l'inscription des électeurs; iv) aider la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions du Kenya à élaborer et à mettre en oeuvre une stratégie visant l'utilisation durable, fiable et crédible de la technologie électorale, en par

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Building capacity of Domestic Observation & Women's Participation / Appui à la transition électorale - Renforcement de
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - BUILDING CAPACITY OF DOMESTIC OBSERVATION & WOMEN'S PARTICIPATION / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - RENFORCEMENT DE
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support envelope of $19.5 million is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes. It includes technical and material support to the Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports local electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   There are several components and various implementing partners of this initiative. Some activities are implemented by civil society organizations in Haiti, and others offer technical support such as that provided by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes. For the elections in 2015, one component provides support through the National Democratic Institute to build capacity for local electoral observation and for women's political participation. / L'objectif de l'enveloppe de 19,5 millions de dollars pour l'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haiti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux. Il inclut l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral et des autres structures nationales électorales clés, et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation locale des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haitienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Il y a plusieurs volets et des partenaires variés d'exécution pour cette initiative. Il y a des activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile en Haiti, et des autres qui offrent un appui technique tel que celui fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haitiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux. Pour les élections en 2015, un volet est fourni par l'Institut national démocratique pour renforcer la capacité pour l'observation locale des élections et pour la participation des femmes au processus politique.

project_title: Advancing Democracy through a Strong and Inclusive Electoral Process / Faire avancer la démocratie au moyen d'un processus électoral solide et inclusi
short_description: ADVANCING DEMOCRACY THROUGH A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE ELECTORAL PROCESS / FAIRE AVANCER LA DÉMOCRATIE AU MOYEN D'UN PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL SOLIDE ET INCLUSI
long_description: The project aims to increase the credibility and effectiveness of elections in Indonesia ahead of the next national elections in 2019, benefitting up to 186 million registered voters. It seeks to strengthen the legal framework and the ability of Indonesia election authorities to administer future elections, reduce election-related violence and increase the participation of women, youth and marginalized groups in the electoral process. The project integrates lessons learned from the 2014 national elections into the next election cycle (2014-2019), most importantly into the new legislature's deliberations on the fundamental electoral legal framework reform.   Project activities are implemented countrywide with a special focus on areas of greatest risk for contested or violent elections, such as Aceh and Eastern Indonesia. Project activities include: (1) providing technical assistance to legislators and civil society on how to prepare and support reforms to elections laws; (2) training women leaders and conducting advocacy campaigns to increase the number of women in the election commission and in political representation; 3) training election management personnel to improve access for voters with disabilities; 4) assisting the election commission with upgrades to key systems and databases such as the voter registration list; (5) developing voter education campaigns and social media tools to inform the electorate (in particular youth, women and marginalized groups) about voting rights, the process and the importance of participation. / Le projet vise à accroitre la crédibilité et l'efficacité des élections en Indonésie avant les prochaines élections nationales en 2019, dont profiteront au plus 186 millions d'électeurs inscrits. Il vise à renforcer le cadre juridique et la capacité des pouvoirs électoraux en Indonésie pour administrer les prochaines élections, réduire la violence liée aux élections et accroitre la participation des femmes, des jeunes et des groupes marginalisés au processus électoral. Le projet compile les leçons tirées des élections nationales en 2014 pour les intégrer au prochain cycle électoral (2014-2019) et, surtout, aux délibérations de la nouvelle assemblée législative sur la réforme du cadre juridique de base des élections. Les activités du projet sont mises en oeuvre à l'échelle du pays, en portant une attention particulière aux régions qui posent les risques les plus élevés d'élections contestées ou violentes, telles qu'Aceh et l'Est de l'Indonésie. project_title: Support to United Nation Development Programme (UNDP) towards Elections planning and management in Kenya
short_description: SUPPORT TO UNITED NATION DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMME (UNDP) TOWARDS ELECTIONS PLANNING AND MANAGEMENT IN KENYA
long_description: To improve the Kenyan Government's accountability to its citizens by providing support to non-governmental organisations, oversight bodies and independent commissions that can influence and deliver reforms thereby supporting the goal of making Kenya a mor

project_title: UNDP: Preparatory Assistance Project Zimbabwe
long_description: At the request of the Government of Zimbabwe, the UN fielded an electoral Needs Assessment Mission (NAM) from 26 May to 5 June 2015. The NAM assessed the capacity needs of the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC) and other election stakeholders as well the electoral environment and the legislative framework governing elections in the country. The NAM recommended both the immediate deployment of short-term support to the ZEC in line with the ZEC request, and also the formulation of a longer-term comprehensive electoral support programme to address the identified capacity needs of ZEC and other election stakeholders (including the Government, ZEC, Parliament, political parties, civil society, voters, private sector and media, among others). This is a Preparatory Assistance Project which is intended to operationalise NAMs recommendation for short term support to ZEC, while the comprehensive support is being developed. The support will include short term assistance to ZEC in the form of expertise in the identified priority areas of voter registration, voter education and budget formulation. The Preparatory Assistance Project will also provide support to facilitate the formulation of a comprehensive electoral capacity strengthening programme for ZEC and other stakeholders.

project_title: Workshop Series for Election Management Bodies on Conflict Sensitive Election Management
short_description: WORKSHOP SERIES FOR ELECTION MANAGEMENT BODIES ON CONFLICT SENSITIVE ELECTION MANAGEMENT
long_description: The Workshop on Conflict Sensitive Election Management will provide electoral authorities with an overview of practical measures and activities to prevent and mitigate election related violence. It will support the authorities to develop internal strategy in electoral security administration and mediation of electoral conflicts. The workshop will take place in countries where elections are scheduled over the next two years (e.g.: Burundi) and is a joint cooperation between the government of Switzerland, Swisspeace and Creative Associates International.

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

long_description: -To understand the election and political system of South Korea and compare the systems of both countries.   -To identify the trends of the election system and political culture issue, and discuss practical approaches in the application of Korean election system   -To contribute to establishing the development of politics and election system reflecting the Korean experiences and know-how -To enhance cooperative relationship among Korea, Fiji and Moldova.

project_title: Ukraine Electoral Law Reform Program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: UKRAINE ELECTORAL LAW REFORM PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The project will promote inclusive dialogue among stakeholders and provide technical assistance in the development of electoral legislation consistent with European standards. The project will support the administration of snap presidential and local elections in May while building the capacity of the Central Elections Commission (CEC) and other election management bodies to organize additional elections in the near future. The project will intensify its assistance in strengthening the CECs training capacity and help the CEC in developing messages and materials for its voter education efforts. The project will also look for opportunities to assist the CEC and other stakeholders in meeting civic demand for more transparency and professionalism in election administration and address the current electoral challenges presented by political instability and security threats.

short_description: UNDP: STRENGTHENING OF THE DEMOCRATIC PROCESS IN EGYPT
long_description: The UNDP programme has a double focus on (1) enhancing electoral procedures, in particular the establishment of an independent electoral management body (2) strengthening the capacity of young and female rural voters to exercise their right to vote. It has won the trust of Egyptian authorities and complements Switzerland's previous support for election observation which found that  although results were consistent with voters' intentions  further process improvements were required.

project_title: Strengthening the independence of election management bodies
short_description: STRENGTHENING THE INDEPENDENCE OF ELECTION MANAGEMENT BODIES
long_description: The goal of the project was to train  civil servants, representatives of the central election commission, representatives of lower-tier electoral bodies; political parties, NGOs involved in elections, experts on election processes and members of the parliamentary legislative commission, and thus improve their expertise on election processes and electoral legislation reform. During two workshops held over three days all together, Slovenian experts presented the significance of an independent central election commission and well-coordinated local electoral bodies, as well as effective forms of communication. The first workshop was, the first day, attended by 51 participants, the second day 25 participants. The second workshop was attended by 44 participants.

project_title: Australia Indonesia Electoral Support Program
long_description: Australia Indonesia Electoral Support Program supports building a prosperous democratic and stable Indonesia. Indonesia's next election will take place in 2014 and approximately 300 sub-national local executive elections will take place between 2011 and 2013. Key objectives are to improve management of elections by electoral management bodies; and increased public engagement in the electoral process. The total value of this initiative is $22.8 million over 5 years, starting 2010-11.

project_title: Fiji Elections Support
long_description: The Australian Civilian Corps (ACC) is a whole of government initiative that deploys civilian specialists to countries experiencing or emerging from natural disaster or conflict, specifically to support stabilisation, recovery and development training. Funding under this initiative supports the deployment of ACC specialists to Fiji to assist in establishing electronic voter registration and conduct capacity assessments and operations planning. The total value of this initiative is $0.3 million over 2 years, starting 2013-14.

short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIAS ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC)and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

project_title: IDEA - Electoral Support
long_description: This project seeks to support key Kenyan democratic institutions in fulfilling their mandates to guarantee a peaceful and levelled playing field in political contestation. The project focuses on three actors, namely the Office of the Registrar of Political Parties (ORPP), the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission's (IEBC) and the com-peting political parties. The intended support will focus primarily on three essential thematic areas: the electoral legal framework, particularly provisions for sound political finance, both democratic standards and gender equality in candidate nomination; and the overall electoral risk-management framework. The thematic areas identified for support under this proposal are consistent with the Electoral and Political Processes priorities outlined in the Kenya Vision 2030's political pillar. The 2030 Vision aims at enacting and operationalizing the necessary policy, legal and institutional framework to support the development of issue-based political processes through, inter alia: the introduction of new laws and regulations covering politi-cal parties; the enhancement of the legal and regulatory framework covering the electoral process; and the strengthening of laws to promote the inclusion of women and other marginalized groups in the electoral process . The modalities of support proposed in the project's outputs and activities consist of providing comparative knowledge, creation of dialogue opportunities, strengthening organisational structures, operational capacities, modes of inter-institutional cooperation, and the legislative framework under which the ORPP, the IEBC and competing political parties operate.

project_title: InformAction, Before the Vote: Mobilizing Field-Based Monitoring for Electoral Accountability
short_description: INFORMACTION, BEFORE THE VOTE: MOBILIZING FIELD-BASED MONITORING FOR ELECTORAL ACCOUNTABILITY
long_description: The project at hand is supported in the context of the preparation of Kenya's general election scheduled for August 2017. The current pre-election period is key to holding peaceful elections. With the campaign starting, there is rising anxiety about the vulnerabilities of the electoral cycle. InformAction, a Kenyan NGO, will apply an innovative approach for monitoring the pre-electoral period and encourage civic action. Through film screening, open discussion and community action it aims to support Kenyan citizens in their claim for fair, accountable and transparent elections in 2017. The current project will encourage community pressure on the authorities, focusing on issues critical to a credible pre-electoral process, such as voter registration, national Identity cards, and conflict mitigation.

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

project_title: Advancing Democracy through a Strong and Inclusive Electoral Process / Faire avancer la démocratie au moyen d'un processus électoral solide et inclusi
short_description: ADVANCING DEMOCRACY THROUGH A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE ELECTORAL PROCESS / FAIRE AVANCER LA DÉMOCRATIE AU MOYEN D'UN PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL SOLIDE ET INCLUSI
long_description: The project aims to increase the credibility and effectiveness of elections in Indonesia ahead of the next national elections in 2019, benefitting up to 186 million registered voters. It seeks to strengthen the legal framework and the ability of Indonesia election authorities to administer future elections, reduce election-related violence and increase the participation of women, youth and marginalized groups in the electoral process. The project integrates lessons learned from the 2014 national elections into the next election cycle (2014-2019), most importantly into the new legislature's deliberations on the fundamental electoral legal framework reform.   Project activities are implemented countrywide with a special focus on areas of greatest risk for contested or violent elections, such as Aceh and Eastern Indonesia. Project activities include: (1) providing technical assistance to legislators and civil society on how to prepare and support reforms to elections laws; (2) training women leaders and conducting advocacy campaigns to increase the number of women in the election commission and in political representation; 3) training election management personnel to improve access for voters with disabilities; 4) assisting the election commission with upgrades to key systems and databases such as the voter registration list; (5) developing voter education campaigns and social media tools to inform the electorate (in particular youth, women and marginalized groups) about voting rights, the process and the importance of participation. / Le projet vise à accroitre la crédibilité et l'efficacité des élections en Indonésie avant les prochaines élections nationales en 2019, dont profiteront au plus 186 millions d'électeurs inscrits. Il vise à renforcer le cadre juridique et la capacité des pouvoirs électoraux en Indonésie pour administrer les prochaines élections, réduire la violence liée aux élections et accroitre la participation des femmes, des jeunes et des groupes marginalisés au processus électoral. Le projet compile les leçons tirées des élections nationales en 2014 pour les intégrer au prochain cycle électoral (2014-2019) et, surtout, aux délibérations de la nouvelle assemblée législative sur la réforme du cadre juridique de base des élections. Les activités du projet sont mises en oeuvre à l'échelle du pays, en portant une attention particulière aux régions qui posent les risques les plus élevés d'élections contestées ou violentes, telles qu'Aceh et l'Est de l'Indonésie. Parmi les activités du projet, citons : 1) fournir une assistance technique aux législateurs et à la société civile sur la manière de préparer et d'appuyer des réformes de lois électorales; 2) former les femmes leaders et mener des campagnes de sensibilisation afin d'accroitre le nombre de femmes au sein de la commission électorale et de la représentation politique; 3) former le personnel de gestion des élections afin d'améliorer l'accès des électeurs handicapés; 4) aider la com

The program also supports the government's civil service reform through targeted technical assistance. The total value of this initiative is $5.6 million over 3 years, starting 2012-13.

project_title: Electoral Assistance Programme 2016
long_description: The overall objectives of this project are 1) to support the Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and other key stakeholders involved in electoral processes in Georgia, Ukraine, the Republic of Moldova and Egypt in building their institutional capacities to conduct and manage independent, free and fair elections.Expected outputs:a.One Electoral Management Summer School, to be implemented in the vicinity of Bucharest, Romania, in July 2016. This activity will bring together 16 junior EMB representatives (with a maximum professional experience in the field of electoral management of 3 years), CSO representatives, students or recent graduates (with a particular focus on political science, low and sociology students) from the Republic of Moldova, Ukraine, Georgia, and Egypt. A maximum of 10 additional participants will be admitted from Romania and other non-ODA coutries in the second edition of the interactive and applied electoral management summer school Summer Elect Camp 2016. The summer school will last for 5 days and will be organised in Romania, in a location within 100 km of Bucharest (to be determined) in July 2016. Experienced PEA practitioners, Romanian civil society representatives and international experts will facilitate the summer school sessions and will deliver the training sessions.

project_title: Burkina Faso 2015 and 2016 elections
long_description: UNDP has applied to Sida for funding of 35 million SEK to carry out the   Elections Support Project in Burkina Faso (2015-2016) - PAE-BF   in Burkinq Faso during the period 2015-2016. The intervention aims at contributing to the organization of transparent and credible elections in conformity with international standards and regional instruments governing the electoral process, including gender equity.by 1) Support the CENI and other institutions for the organization and holding of elections; 2) Support for Civic education, women's participation and mobilization of voters; 3) Prevention, conflict management and education for peace; and 4) Sustainability of the achievements and long-term capacity building of CENI. UNDP will implement the intervention together with CENI and other national institutions involved in the electoral process. The intervention's total budget is 84,6 million SEK (10 000 000 USD), out of which UNDP's own funding is approximately 6,77 million SEK (800 millon USD) and the remaining 77,83 million SEK (9,2 million USD) is contributed by Suisse, Canada and Japan. Approximately a financial gap of 41,5 million SEK (4.9 million USD) is remaining.

short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO CHAHED OBSERVATORY FOR MONITORING ELECTIONS AND SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIC REFORM
long_description: To promote a transparent electoral process through a domestic election monitoring initiative. The program will consist of two, three-day capacity building workshops on local governance for 48 regional coordinators, and 12 one-day regional workshops for 300 long-term observers on domestic election guidelines including voter registration, electoral campaigning, and election day processes.

project_title: Liberia Administrative and Systems Strengthening (LASS) - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: LIBERIA ADMINISTRATIVE AND SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING (LASS) - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: Liberia is approaching its first post-conflict democratic transition of power in the 2017 general elections. The purpose of the Liberia Administrative and Systems Strengthening (LASS) Task Order is to work with the National Elections Commission (NEC) to develop key institutional systems, policies, and procedures in areas such as human resources, budgeting and financial management, asset management, strategic planning, and procurement. With strong systems in place the NEC is better situated to achieve its core mandate of planning and conducting elections. LASS will use problem-driven rather than solutions-led approaches in working with the NEC to allow for greater ownership and participation by NEC officials.

project_title: Legislative Strengthening and Citizen Access to Public Budget Information - Sunu Budget - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: LEGISLATIVE STRENGTHENING AND CITIZEN ACCESS TO PUBLIC BUDGET INFORMATION - SUNU BUDGET - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: This activity will continue to support constructive dialogue between citizen groups and the legislative and executive branches of government. Funding will support civil society organizations in using public budget information and analysis for informed advocacy to governments at local and national levels, by making public budget information available and supporting actionable analysis of budgets. The activity will continue working with the Government of Senegal (GOS) on efforts toward open and transparent budgeting. As a result, citizens will be better informed about how their tax dollars are being used, and the GOS will be better able to show accountability to citizens, and will also be better aligned with international standards on transparent public financial management.

agency_name: Swiss Agency for Development and Co-operation
project_title: Support to Tanzania's Election Cycle 2013  2016 (STEC 13-16)
long_description: The proposed intervention supports the Tanzanian Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and the media in Tanzania for the Constitutional referendum 2014 and local and general elections in 2014/2015. EMBs will be supported for institutional reforms and capacity strengthening to guarantee free and credible elections. The media will be strengthened in its role as watchdog and citizen informer to provide for impartial political reporting.

project_title: Deepening Democratic Governance Programme-Technical Assistance
long_description: To strengthen democratic governance in Ghana through the provision of targeted financial and technical assistance to key Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and civil society. This is to strengthen the institutional capacity of EMBs to support transparent

project_title: Workshop Series for Election Management Bodies on  Conflict Sensitive Election Management
short_description: WORKSHOP SERIES FOR ELECTION MANAGEMENT BODIES ON  CONFLICT SENSITIVE ELECTION MANAGEMENT
long_description: The Workshop  on Conflict Sensitive Election Management  will provide electoral authorities with an overview of practical measures and activities to prevent and mitigate election related violence. It will support the authorities to develop internal strategy in electoral security administration and mediation of electoral conflicts. The workshop will take place in countries where elections are scheduled over the next two years (e.g.: Burundi) and is a joint cooperation between the Swiss government, Swisspeace and Creative Associates International.

project_title: Advancing Armenias Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIAS ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC)and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenias strategic objectives.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Penplusbytes
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO PENPLUSBYTES
long_description: To advocate for peaceful, transparent, credible, and issue-based elections in Ghana. The grantee will launch a political campaign fact-checking website and establish a social media tracking center to detect election irregularities, logistics problems, fraud, and potential violence. These efforts will enable electoral management bodies and civil society to intervene.

project_title: Kenya Electoral System Support / Appui au système électoral du Kenya
short_description: KENYA ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT / APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU KENYA
long_description: This initiative seeks to reduce the barriers that prevented the participation of 45.7% of the eligible voting population in the 2007 elections by implementing a civic and voter education program. The project also focuses on improving voter registration and identification systems. The goal is to ensure the accuracy, credibility and representativeness of the voters' roll so that previously disadvantaged groups, such as women and youth, are included.   Some project activities include: (i) conducting focus groups and stakeholder consultations in five pilot constituencies to collect information on low voter turnout, particularly among women and youth; (ii) implementing a civic and voter education program in up to five pilot constituencies, with help from Elections Canada, and scaling the program up to the national level; (iii) working with Kenya's Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) and the National Registration Bureau (NRB) to establish a protocol for sharing national citizen registration and voter registration data between the two organizations to capture the necessary voter registration information; and (iv) supporting Kenya's IEBC to develop and implement a strategy for the sustainable, reliable and credible use of election technology, in particular, biometric voter registration kits. / Cette initiative vise à aplanir les obstacles en raison desquels 45,7 % des personnes ayant le droit de vote n'ont pas participé aux élections de 2007, plus précisément par la mise en oeuvre d'un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs. Elle met également l'accent sur l'amélioration des systèmes d'inscription et d'identification des électeurs. Le but est de faire en sorte que les registres électoraux soient exacts, crédibles et représentatifs, de façon à assurer la participation des groupes autrefois désavantagés, dont les femmes et les jeunes.   Parmi les activités de l'initiative : i) tenir des groupes de discussion et des consultations auprès des intervenants dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes pour recueillir des renseignements sur le faible taux de participation aux élections, en particulier chez les femmes et les jeunes; ii) mettre en oeuvre un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes au maximum, avec l'aide d'Élections Canada, et déployer le programme à l'échelle nationale; iii) collaborer avec la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions et le Bureau national de l'enregistrement du Kenya à l'établissement d'un protocole de mise en commun des données nationales d'enregistrement des citoyens et d'inscription des électeurs par ces deux organismes, dans le but de consigner les renseignements nécessaires pour l'inscription des électeurs; iv) aider la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions du Kenya à élaborer et à mettre en oeuvre une stratégie visant l'utilisation durable, fiable et crédible de la technologie électorale, en par

project_title: Strengthening Electoral and Legislative Processes (SELP)
long_description: Assisting Election Commission of Pakistan in improving its electoral management capacity and parliaments to function effectively in the context of Democracy in Pakistan.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to MOST
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO MOST
long_description: To promote free and fair elections by improving the electoral process. In advance of early parliamentary elections, this initiative will conduct nonpartisan activities and advocate for electoral reforms, monitor the review of the voters list, improve the process of resolving electoral disputes, and raise awareness about voter registration and the right to vote. The group also will monitor the pre-election political environment and performance of parliament, and raise awareness regarding separation between the state and political parties.

project_title: SUPPORT TO MEDIA DEVELOPMENT
long_description: Capacity of democratic institutions including Electoral Management Bodies, Parliament and Media enhanced to promote democratic governance

project_title: Support to NCCE invovlved in the electoral cycle 2016 2018
short_description: SUPPORT TO NCCE INVOVLVED IN THE ELECTORAL CYCLE 2016 2018
long_description: Strengthened NCCE's capacity to perform its constitutional mandate in respect of the 2016 general elections, and beyond. NCCE's operational capacity to perform its mandate in a coordinated manner is enhanced in election management ' dialogue with media and political parties.  NCCE's capacity to create voter awareness with specific focus on women and disadvantaged groups is enhanced, leading to increase in both accountability and credibility of the electoral process. Women's participation in the

project_title: Electoral Transition Support - Building capacity of Domestic Observation & Women's Participation / Appui à la transition électorale - Renforcement de
short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - BUILDING CAPACITY OF DOMESTIC OBSERVATION & WOMEN'S PARTICIPATION / APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - RENFORCEMENT DE
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support envelope of $19.5 million is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes. It includes technical and material support to the Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports local electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.   There are several components and various implementing partners of this initiative. Some activities are implemented by civil society organizations in Haiti, and others offer technical support such as that provided by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes. For the elections in 2015, one component provides support through the National Democratic Institute to build capacity for local electoral observation and for women's political participation. / L'objectif de l'enveloppe de 19,5 millions de dollars pour l'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haiti. Il appuie l'organisation de scrutins libres, transparents et équitables au cours des processus électoraux. Il inclut l'appui en termes d'assistance technique et matérielle auprès du Conseil électoral et des autres structures nationales électorales clés, et un fonds réactif qui permet d'entreprendre l'observation locale des processus électoraux et d'appuyer des programmes de sensibilisation auprès de la population haitienne afin d'encourager leur participation aux scrutins.   Il y a plusieurs volets et des partenaires variés d'exécution pour cette initiative. Il y a des activités réalisées par des organisations de la société civile en Haiti, et des autres qui offrent un appui technique tel que celui fourni par Élections Canada aux autorités haitiennes dans l'organisation et la gestion de processus électoraux. Pour les élections en 2015, un volet est fourni par l'Institut national démocratique pour renforcer la capacité pour l'observation locale des élections et pour la participation des femmes au processus politique.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to National Election Watch
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO NATIONAL ELECTION WATCH
long_description: To assess the preparedness of election actors to contribute to peaceful and transparent national elections in 2018. The grantee will organize one meeting of its strategic management committee in each district across the country to identify the roles and responsibilities of local actors who will be engaged in electoral activities. The organization will also hold two seminars in each district on citizen concerns in the elections. Ultimately, the grantee will use the findings of their election seminars to inform their pre-electoral work in 2017.

project_title: Building Sustainable Elections Management in Liberia - Elections and Political Processes
short_description: BUILDING SUSTAINABLE ELECTIONS MANAGEMENT IN LIBERIA - ELECTIONS AND POLITICAL PROCESSES
long_description: The aim of this Building Sustainable Election Management in Liberia project is to increase the capacity of the NEC to efficiently, effectively, and impartially manage the upcoming elections. IFES support to building the NECs institutional and professional capacity will allow it to conduct elections with decreasing levels of international support.

project_title: ODIHR / IPA II - Support to the follow-up of electoral recommendations in the Western Balkans
short_description: ODIHR / IPA II - SUPPORT TO THE FOLLOW-UP OF ELECTORAL RECOMMENDATIONS IN THE WESTERN BALKANS
long_description: The assistance in Western Balkan Sates (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro, Serbia) to bring the conduct of elections closer in line with OSCE commitments and other international  obligations and standards for democratic elections with the aim to enhance public confidence in electoral management bodies and key electoral processes is the aim of the project.

project_title: Election Support in El Salvador
long_description: Support of voter registration and counting by training of poll clerks by UNDP

project_title: Project to Support the Electoral Cycle in Madagascar (SACEM)
short_description: PROJECT TO SUPPORT THE ELECTORAL CYCLE IN MADAGASCAR (SACEM)
long_description: Support to basket fund administered by UNDP to prepare for elections in Madagascar 2018. Financial management through Norwegian participation in steering committee.

project_title: IDEA - Electoral Support
long_description: This project seeks to support key Kenyan democratic institutions in fulfilling their mandates to guarantee a peaceful and levelled playing field in political contestation. The project focuses on three actors, namely the Office of the Registrar of Political Parties (ORPP), the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission's (IEBC) and the com-peting political parties. The intended support will focus primarily on three essential thematic areas: the electoral legal framework, particularly provisions for sound political finance, both democratic standards and gender equality in candidate nomination; and the overall electoral risk-management framework. The thematic areas identified for support under this proposal are consistent with the Electoral and Political Processes priorities outlined in the Kenya Vision 2030's political pillar. The 2030 Vision aims at enacting and operationalizing the necessary policy, legal and institutional framework to support the development of issue-based political processes through, inter alia: the introduction of new laws and regulations covering politi-cal parties; the enhancement of the legal and regulatory framework covering the electoral process; and the strengthening of laws to promote the inclusion of women and other marginalized groups in the electoral process . The modalities of support proposed in the project's outputs and activities consist of providing comparative knowledge, creation of dialogue opportunities, strengthening organisational structures, operational capacities, modes of inter-institutional cooperation, and the legislative framework under which the ORPP, the IEBC and competing political parties operate.

project_title: Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa: High-Level Workshop on the Peaceful Resolution of Electoral Disputes in Zimbabwe.
short_description: ELECTORAL INSTITUTE FOR SUSTAINABLE DEMOCRACY IN AFRICA: HIGH-LEVEL WORKSHOP ON THE PEACEFUL RESOLUTION OF ELECTORAL DISPUTES IN ZIMBABWE.
long_description: Switzerland will assist the Zimbabwe Electoral Commission (ZEC), in partnership with Electoral Institute for Sustainable Democracy in Africa (EISA) in convening a high-level workshop on the prevention and resolution of electoral disputes (EDR) to take place in May 2017. It combines technical electoral expertise and dialogue facilitation for conflict prevention. Zimbabwe's elections have been fraught with offenses and disputes, and perpetrators are rarely sanctioned. In this workshop, all the key stakeholders (Police, Judiciary, political parties, traditional leaders, independent Commissions) will be brought together to develop a common understanding of the existing EDR framework to identify concrete measures for conflict prevention and mitigation of electoral violence in the upcoming voter registration process. International experiences will be introduced to allow reflection on their applicability to Zimbabwe. The workshop is also expected to identify different strands of follow-up programmatic work, such as strengthening the code of conduct for political parties or establishing dispute management committees to accompany the voter registration process.

long_description: The proposed intervention supports the Tanzanian Electoral Management Bodies (EMBs) and the media in Tanzania for the Constitutional referendum 2014 and local and general elections in 2014/2015. The media will be strengthened in its role as watchdog and citizen informer to provide for impartial political reporting.

project_title: InformAction, Before the Vote: Mobilizing Field-Based Monitoring for Electoral Accountability
short_description: INFORMACTION, BEFORE THE VOTE: MOBILIZING FIELD-BASED MONITORING FOR ELECTORAL ACCOUNTABILITY
long_description: The project at hand is supported in the context of the preparation of Kenya's general election scheduled for August 2017. The current pre-election period is key to holding peaceful elections. With the campaign starting, there is rising anxiety about the vulnerabilities of the electoral cycle. InformAction, a Kenyan NGO, will apply an innovative approach for monitoring the pre-electoral period and encourage civic action. Through film screening, open discussion and community action it aims to support Kenyan citizens in their claim for fair, accountable and transparent elections in 2017. The current project will encourage community pressure on the authorities, focusing on issues critical to a credible pre-electoral process, such as voter registration, national Identity cards, and conflict mitigation.

short_description: ELECTORAL TRANSITION SUPPORT - BUILDING CAPACITY OF DOMESTIC OBSERVATION & WOMEN'S PARTICIPATION/APPUI À LA TRANSITION ÉLECTORALE - RENFORCEMENT DE L'
long_description: The objective of the Electoral Transition Support envelope of $19.5 million is to contribute to national efforts to strengthen democracy and good governance in Haiti. It supports the organization of free, transparent, and fair elections during electoral processes. It includes technical and material support to the Electoral Council and other key national electoral bodies, and a responsive fund that supports local electoral observation and public awareness programs that encourage Haitians to participate in elections.There are several components and various implementing partners of this initiative. Some activities are implemented by civil society organizations in Haiti, and others offer technical support such as that provided by Elections Canada to Haitian authorities for the organization and management of electoral processes. For the elections in 2015, one component provides support through the National Democratic Institute to build capacity for local electoral observation and for women's political participation./ L'objectif de l'enveloppe de 19,5 millions de dollars pour l'Appui à la transition électorale est de contribuer aux efforts nationaux en matière de consolidation de la démocratie et de la bonne gouvernance en Haïti.
