project_title: Advancing Democracy through a Strong and Inclusive Electoral Process/Faire avancer la démocratie au moyen d'un processus électoral solide et inclusif
short_description: ADVANCING DEMOCRACY THROUGH A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE ELECTORAL PROCESS/FAIRE AVANCER LA DÉMOCRATIE AU MOYEN D'UN PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL SOLIDE ET INCLUSIF
long_description: The project aims to increase the credibility and effectiveness of elections in Indonesia ahead of the next national elections in 2019, benefitting up to 186 million registered voters. It seeks to strengthen the legal framework and the ability of Indonesia election authorities to administer future elections, reduce election-related violence and increase the participation of women, youth and marginalized groups in the electoral process. The project integrates lessons learned from the 2014 national elections into the next election cycle (20142019), most importantly into the new legislature's deliberations on the fundamental electoral legal framework reform.Project activities are implemented countrywide with a special focus on areas of greatest risk for contested or violent elections, such as Aceh and Eastern Indonesia. Project activities include: (1) providing technical assistance to legislators and civil society on how to prepare and support reforms to elections laws; (2) training women leaders and conducting advocacy campaigns to increase the number of women in the election commission and in political representation; (3) training election management personnel to improve access for voters with disabilities; (4) assisting the election commission with upgrades to key systems and databases such as the voter registration list; (5) developing voter education campaigns and social media tools to inform the electorate (in particular youth, women and marginalized groups) about voting rights, the process and the importance of participation./ Le projet vise à accroître la crédibilité et l'efficacité des élections en Indonésie avant les prochaines élections nationales en 2019, dont profiteront au plus 186 millions d'électeurs inscrits. Il vise à renforcer le cadre juridique et la capacité des pouvoirs électoraux en Indonésie pour administrer les prochaines élections, réduire la violence liée aux élections et accroître la participation des femmes, des jeunes et des groupes marginalisés au processus électoral. Le projet compile les leçons tirées des élections nationales en 2014 pour les intégrer au prochain cycle électoral (2014-2019) et, surtout, aux délibérations de la nouvelle assemblée législative sur la réforme du cadre juridique de base des élections.Les activités du projet sont mises en uvre à l'échelle du pays, en portant une attention particulière aux régions qui posent les risques les plus élevés d'élections contestées ou violentes, telles qu'Aceh et l'Est de l'Indonésie. Parmi les activités du projet, citons : 1) fournir une assistance technique aux législateurs et à la société civile sur la manière de préparer et d'appuyer des réformes de lois électorales; 2) former les femmes leaders et mener des campagnes de sensibilisation afin d'accroître le nombre de femmes au sein de la commission électorale et de la représentation politique; 3) former le personnel de gestion des élections afin d'améliorer l'accès des électeurs handicapés; 4) aider la commiss

project_title: Ukraine Electoral Law Reform Program
long_description: The project will promote inclusive dialogue among stakeholders and provide technical assistance in the development of electoral legislation consistent with European standards. The project will support the administration of snap presidential and local elections in May while building the capacity of the Central Elections Commission (CEC) and other election management bodies to organize additional elections in the near future. The project will intensify its assistance in strengthening the CEC's training capacity and help the CEC in developing messages and materials for its voter education efforts. The project will also look for opportunities to assist the CEC and other stakeholders in meeting civic demand for more transparency and professionalism in election administration and address the current electoral challenges presented by political instability and security threats.

long_description: To assist Sri Lanka's election management body, build the EMB's institutional capacity to administer credible and inclusive elections, and improve the content and efficacy of voter education programs.

long_description: Associate Cooperative Agreement for the implementation of Post-election Support Program in Niger: Increased legislative and civil society oversight over natural resources (mining sector) exploitation and management.

short_description: MYANMAR-AUSTRALIA PARTNERSHIP FOR REFORM: IMPROVING GOVERNANCE
long_description: Funding under this investment follows the Myanmar-Australia Partnership for Reform, which aims to help strengthen democratic institutions and transparent revenue management, promote human rights and support credible elections. The total value of this investment is $21.2 million commenced in the 2014-15 financial year.

project_title: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators Network Support Program 2016-2019
short_description: PACIFIC ISLANDS, AUSTRALIA AND NEW ZEALAND ELECTORAL ADMINISTRATORS NETWORK SUPPORT PROGRAM 2016-2019
long_description: Pacific Islands, Australia and New Zealand Electoral Administrators Network (PIANZEA) Support Program enables the AEC to enhance the capacity of electoral administration and build the capacity of electoral management bodies. Over time this will support provision of high quality electoral services, which support democratic process. The program supports a work plan covering a range of activities including training, conferences, exchanges and technical support and advice. The total value of this investment is $1.7 million over 4 years, starting May 2016.

project_title: Voter registration is updated.
long_description: Voter registration is updated and voter registration process is improved  to further enable the upcoming 2017 elections to become a success.

long_description: Enhancing Citizen Participation in the Electoral Process 2017. Devolved Governance and conflict management in conflict-affected counties

Enhanced proper planning and  administration of voter registration, the constitutional referendum, and remaining elections, 2. Inclusive electoral legal reform  supported, and 3. Increased participation in the electoral process

project_title: Election Observation. Supporting democratization in newer democracies.
short_description: ELECTION OBSERVATION. SUPPORTING DEMOCRATIZATION IN NEWER DEMOCRACIES.
long_description: Icelandic representatives observed elections in OSCE member states in Central Asia and Eastern Europe. OSCE has developed approved methodes in election assistance and observation that include more dimensions than just the processes taking place during the electoral day. Endeavours are made to include all the factors that contribute to a democratic election, i.e. electoral laws and rules, election committees at every level, election campaigns and the involvement of the media in the election campaign to name a few. Complaints from voters and political parties are investigated and registered. On the day of the election polling places are under observation, this also applies for counting and how votes and other voting material is handled. Usually a few dozen election inspectors reside in the country in question to make certain preparations. A few days prior to election day the number of inspectors is increased - usually a few hundred but some times they are close to a thousand. Shortly before election day the inspectors are distributed around the country in accordance to a special system. These procedures are to secure significant evaluation of the election procedure.

project_title: Capacity building for Central Electoral Commissions through  local election observation in Latvia
short_description: CAPACITY BUILDING FOR CENTRAL ELECTORAL COMMISSIONS THROUGH  LOCAL ELECTION OBSERVATION IN LATVIA
long_description: Visits of election administrators from the mentioned countries with the purpose of election observation during advance voting and on the election day, exchange of experience in development and functioning of the voters' register, regulation and control of party financing, as well as studying the Latvian experience of the innovations in management of voters' register and vote counting at polling stations.

project_title: UNDP - Support to the 2015-2018 Liberian Electoral Cycle/PNUD - Appui au cycle électoral libérien 2015-2018
short_description: UNDP - SUPPORT TO THE 2015-2018 LIBERIAN ELECTORAL CYCLE/PNUD - APPUI AU CYCLE ÉLECTORAL LIBÉRIEN 2015-2018
long_description: The UN and more specifically the UNDP has long supported Liberia's democratization process and towards this end it has identified specific goals to improve the democratic environment in the country. UNDP's partnership with the Liberian election management body, the National Elections Commission NEC and other national partners are well established based on previous support provided through the five year periods: 2010-2014. These include efforts to strengthen key democratic institutions to have improved capacity to fulfill their electoral functions.In response to the request for United Nations assistance from the Government of Liberia, the overall objective of this project is to enhance inclusion and conflict prevention in Liberia through improved electoral institutions and processes as identified by the NEC (2012-2018) strategic plan's key areas of intervention.Along with the NEC, support will be provided to other key actors including the Inter Party Consultative Committee (IPCC), the Constitutional Review Commission (CRC), Liberia National Police (LPN), the Media, and Civil Society Organizations, that focus on building effective engagement in democratic processes through dialogue and peace building initiatives./ Ce projet vise à renforcer la capacité de la commission électorale nationale du Libéria (CEN) et des acteurs électoraux de premier plan d'exécuter leurs activités de base de façon impartiale, transparente et durable,  et de mener à bien les processus électoraux prévus lors du cycle électoral de 2015 à 2018. Outre la CEN, d'autres intervenants clés recevront un soutien, dont le comité consultatif interpartis (CCI), la commission d'examen de la constitution (CEC), la police nationale du Libéria (PNL) ainsi que les médias et les organisations de la société civile qui cherchent à favoriser la participation efficace et l'inclusion des femmes et des jeunes dans les processus démocratiques et les initiatives de consolidation de la paix.La contribution financière du Canada pour la réalisation de ce projet, qui pourrait atteindre jusqu'à 1 million $ CA répartis sur deux exercices (2016-2017 à 2017-2018), servira à promouvoir la mise en uvre de changements institutionnels pour accroître l'indépendance et la crédibilité du gouvernement du Libéria et sa capacité de tenir des élections pacifiques, et à renforcer la capacité de la commission électorale nationale de réaliser des acquis à long terme au chapitre de la démocratie au Libéria et de développer la confiance du public en son gouvernement.

project_title: Advancing Democracy through a Strong and Inclusive Electoral Process/Faire avancer la démocratie au moyen d'un processus électoral solide et inclusif
short_description: ADVANCING DEMOCRACY THROUGH A STRONG AND INCLUSIVE ELECTORAL PROCESS/FAIRE AVANCER LA DÉMOCRATIE AU MOYEN D'UN PROCESSUS ÉLECTORAL SOLIDE ET INCLUSIF
long_description: The project aims to increase the credibility and effectiveness of elections in Indonesia ahead of the next national elections in 2019, benefitting up to 186 million registered voters. It seeks to strengthen the legal framework and the ability of Indonesia election authorities to administer future elections, reduce election-related violence and increase the participation of women, youth and marginalized groups in the electoral process. The project integrates lessons learned from the 2014 national elections into the next election cycle (20142019), most importantly into the new legislature's deliberations on the fundamental electoral legal framework reform.Project activities are implemented countrywide with a special focus on areas of greatest risk for contested or violent elections, such as Aceh and Eastern Indonesia. Project activities include: (1) providing technical assistance to legislators and civil society on how to prepare and support reforms to elections laws; (2) training women leaders and conducting advocacy campaigns to increase the number of women in the election commission and in political representation; (3) training election management personnel to improve access for voters with disabilities; (4) assisting the election commission with upgrades to key systems and databases such as the voter registration list; (5) developing voter education campaigns and social media tools to inform the electorate (in particular youth, women and marginalized groups) about voting rights, the process and the importance of participation./ Le projet vise à accroître la crédibilité et l'efficacité des élections en Indonésie avant les prochaines élections nationales en 2019, dont profiteront au plus 186 millions d'électeurs inscrits. Il vise à renforcer le cadre juridique et la capacité des pouvoirs électoraux en Indonésie pour administrer les prochaines élections, réduire la violence liée aux élections et accroître la participation des femmes, des jeunes et des groupes marginalisés au processus électoral. Le projet compile les leçons tirées des élections nationales en 2014 pour les intégrer au prochain cycle électoral (2014-2019) et, surtout, aux délibérations de la nouvelle assemblée législative sur la réforme du cadre juridique de base des élections.Les activités du projet sont mises en uvre à l'échelle du pays, en portant une attention particulière aux régions qui posent les risques les plus élevés d'élections contestées ou violentes, telles qu'Aceh et l'Est de l'Indonésie. Parmi les activités du projet, citons : 1) fournir une assistance technique aux législateurs et à la société civile sur la manière de préparer et d'appuyer des réformes de lois électorales; 2) former les femmes leaders et mener des campagnes de sensibilisation afin d'accroître le nombre de femmes au sein de la commission électorale et de la représentation politique; 3) former le personnel de gestion des élections afin d'améliorer l'accès des électeurs handicapés; 4) aider la commiss

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Ligue des Femmes pour le Developpement et l'Education a la Democratie
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO LIGUE DES FEMMES POUR LE DEVELOPPEMENT ET L'EDUCATION A LA DEMOCRATIE
long_description: To educate Tshangu District's residents on measures taken to ensure peaceful elections. The organization will first instruct local civil society leaders on the details of the New Year's Eve political accord and UN Resolution 2348. It will then organize awareness rallies on the same topic for the local population, and task several associates with monitoring the voter registration process.

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to National Democratic Institute for International Affairs (NDI)
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO NATIONAL DEMOCRATIC INSTITUTE FOR INTERNATIONAL AFFAIRS (NDI)
long_description: To promote greater coordination and consensus on shared norms and principles of electoral integrity. The institute will facilitate targeted exchanges and dialogue between and among citizen observers, international observers, and election management bodies. To build capacity among members of the Global Network of Domestic Election Monitors (GNDEM), the institute will foster in-person and online experience sharing and will adapt, develop, and disseminate new tools and resources for enhancing systematic election observation methodologies.

project_title: Advancing Armenia's Election Management and Democratic Culture (AAEM-DC) Program
short_description: ADVANCING ARMENIA'S ELECTION MANAGEMENT AND DEMOCRATIC CULTURE (AAEM-DC) PROGRAM
long_description: The purpose of the project was to strengthen the administration of electoral processes and assist the electoral administration to meet international standards for free and fair elections through its support of the Central Election Commission (CEC)and the Passport and Visa Department of the Police of the Republic of Armenia (OVIR) which is responsible for maintaining the national voter list. The purpose of the evaluation is to assess the success of the project and to evaluate its effectiveness in achieving its programmatic goals and USAID/Armenia's strategic objectives.

project_title: Seminar for the improvement of electoral laws and system
short_description: SEMINAR FOR THE IMPROVEMENT OF ELECTORAL LAWS AND SYSTEM
long_description: a) To seek measures to improve an electoral law system in participating countries by analyzing and comparing them with that in the Republic of Korea; b) To share know-how and experience in the field of election management among participating countries;  c) To promote international exchanges and cooperation among participating countries

project_title: Project to Support Building Electoral Transparency through Automation of Voting and Counting System in Democratic Republic of Fiji
short_description: PROJECT TO SUPPORT BUILDING ELECTORAL TRANSPARENCY THROUGH AUTOMATION OF VOTING AND COUNTING SYSTEM IN DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF FIJI
long_description: Provide a Touch-screen Voting System (TVS), upgrade the data center, dispatch experts, and conduct capacity building programs for election officials to support the introduction of ICT for election management in the Democratic Republic of Fiji

project_title: Project to support CAPACITY BUILDING OF ICT ELECTION MANAGEMENT in the Republic of El Salvador
short_description: PROJECT TO SUPPORT CAPACITY BUILDING OF ICT ELECTION MANAGEMENT IN THE REPUBLIC OF EL SALVADOR
long_description: Establish an efficient and transparent election system to support the management of the parliamentary elections of El Salvador in 2018 by providing an election ICT device to transmit counting results

project_title: Fiji Transition to Democracy
long_description: The Fiji Transition to Democracy initiative aims to: support Fiji Elections Office to help conduct a national voter registration exercise as part of the introduction of electronic voter registration; support to the Constitution Commission; and support for civic education by working with the United Nations Development Program to implement a national civic education program with civil society and government. The program also supports the government's civil service reform through targeted technical assistance. The total value of this initiative is $5.6 million over 3 years, starting 2012-13.

project_title: Strengthening the Electoral Cycle in the Solomon Islands Project (SECSIP)
short_description: STRENGTHENING THE ELECTORAL CYCLE IN THE SOLOMON ISLANDS PROJECT (SECSIP)
long_description: To support the electoral cycle in the Solomon Islands between 2013 and 2016, taking into account the national elections in 2014. The principal focus is to assist in the development of a sustainable, cost effective and inclusive voter registration system to ensure the integrity of the 2014 vote

project_title: SUPPORT TO MEDIA DEVELOPMENT
long_description: Capacity of democratic institutions including Electoral Management Bodies, Parliament and Media enhanced to promote democratic governance

project_title: National Electoral Commission
long_description: Capacity strengthening of election management authority

project_title: Capacity Building for EMBs
long_description: Capacity of Election Management Bodies enhanced to conduct inclusive and credible elections

project_title: ZIM - ECO
long_description: The multi-year programmatic initiative supports capacity building for ZEC, strengthening of voter registration, developing of a robust voter education programme and effective ZEC engagement with election stakeholders.

project_title: Post-Elections Technical Assistance to Angola
long_description: Angola conducted elections in August 2017. Prior to the elections, Norway supported a project aimed at capacity building in the areas of democratic awareness and electoral observation (AGO-17/0002). The current project aims to expand the post-elections technical assistance to address a wider set of challenges identified from the August elections, including within the electoral management, electoral dispute processes and mechanisms, political intolerance and access to media.

project_title: Kenya Electoral System Support/Appui au système électoral du Kenya
short_description: KENYA ELECTORAL SYSTEM SUPPORT/APPUI AU SYSTÈME ÉLECTORAL DU KENYA
long_description: This initiative seeks to reduce the barriers that prevented the participation of 45.7% of the eligible voting population in the 2007 elections by implementing a civic and voter education program. The project also focuses on improving voter registration and identification systems. The goal is to ensure the accuracy, credibility and representativeness of the voters' roll so that previously disadvantaged groups, such as women and youth, are included.Some project activities include: (i) conducting focus groups and stakeholder consultations in five pilot constituencies to collect information on low voter turnout, particularly among women and youth; (ii) implementing a civic and voter education program in up to five pilot constituencies, with help from Elections Canada, and scaling the program up to the national level; (iii) working with Kenya's Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission (IEBC) and the National Registration Bureau (NRB) to establish a protocol for sharing national citizen registration and voter registration data between the two organizations to capture the necessary voter registration information; and (iv) supporting Kenya's IEBC to develop and implement a strategy for the sustainable, reliable and credible use of election technology, in particular, biometric voter registration kits./ Cette initiative vise à aplanir les obstacles en raison desquels 45,7 % des personnes ayant le droit de vote n'ont pas participé aux élections de 2007, plus précisément par la mise en uvre d'un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs. Elle met également l'accent sur l'amélioration des systèmes d'inscription et d'identification des électeurs. Le but est de faire en sorte que les registres électoraux soient exacts, crédibles et représentatifs, de façon à assurer la participation des groupes autrefois désavantagés, dont les femmes et les jeunes.Parmi les activités de l'initiative : i) tenir des groupes de discussion et des consultations auprès des intervenants dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes pour recueillir des renseignements sur le faible taux de participation aux élections, en particulier chez les femmes et les jeunes; ii) mettre en uvre un programme d'éducation civique des électeurs dans cinq circonscriptions pilotes au maximum, avec l'aide d'Élections Canada, et déployer le programme à l'échelle nationale; iii) collaborer avec la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions et le Bureau national de l'enregistrement du Kenya à l'établissement d'un protocole de mise en commun des données nationales d'enregistrement des citoyens et d'inscription des électeurs par ces deux organismes, dans le but de consigner les renseignements nécessaires pour l'inscription des électeurs; iv) aider la Commission électorale indépendante chargée du redécoupage des circonscriptions du Kenya à élaborer et à mettre en uvre une stratégie visant l'utilisation durable, fiable et crédible de la technologie électorale, en particulier

project_title: National Endowment for Democracy Grant to Health and Rural Development (HARD) Balochistan
short_description: NATIONAL ENDOWMENT FOR DEMOCRACY GRANT TO HEALTH AND RURAL DEVELOPMENT (HARD) BALOCHISTAN
long_description: To enhance womens political participation in elections. The grantee will establish centers to facilitate voter registration of women in five communities in Quetta district. In addition, youth volunteers will carry out a series of awareness-raising activities for community leaders, women, and youth to encourage participation in electoral processes and strengthen civic engagement.

project_title: Support to the follow-up of electoral recommendations in the Western Balkans
short_description: SUPPORT TO THE FOLLOW-UP OF ELECTORAL RECOMMENDATIONS IN THE WESTERN BALKANS
long_description: The overall objective of the action is to assist five OSCE participating States in the Western Balkans region (Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro, Serbia) and Kosovo* in bringing the conduct of elections closer in line with OSCE commitments and other international obligations and standards for democratic elections with the aim to enhance public confidence in electoral management bodies and key electoral processes.

project_title: Support to NCCE invovlved in the electoral cycle 2016-2018
short_description: SUPPORT TO NCCE INVOVLVED IN THE ELECTORAL CYCLE 2016-2018
long_description: Strengthened NCCE's capacity to perform its constitutional mandate in respect of the 2016 general elections, and beyond. NCCE's operational capacity to perform its mandate in a coordinated manner is enhanced in election management ' dialogue with media and political parties.  NCCE's capacity to create voter awareness with specific focus on women and disadvantaged groups is enhanced, leading to increase in both accountability and credibility of the electoral process. project_title: Procurement and Grants to Support to Electoral Reform in Cambodia
short_description: PROCUREMENT AND GRANTS TO SUPPORT TO ELECTORAL REFORM IN CAMBODIA
long_description: Financing Agreement No ACA/2015/38-007: ''Support to Electoral Reform in Cambodia'' aims to support the reform process initiated by the political agreement reached by the two main political parties in Cambodia in July 2014. The purpose of this Delegation Agreement is to implement this Financing Agreement. This project will include i) technical assistance to NEC, ii) procurement of equipment to be undertaken by UNOPS as a measure to support voter registration and polling, iii) issuance of grants

project_title: Elections Organisation&Mgmt
long_description: This output focues on improving the organisation and management of Elections through improved management systems and conducting institutional assessements of MEC

project_title: Voter Registration
long_description: This output aims to make a diagnosis of the current legal Framework in order to know the gaps and insufficiencies.

project_title: SEMB
long_description: Strengthening Election Management in Bangladesh

project_title: IDEA - Electoral Support
long_description: This project seeks to support key Kenyan democratic institutions in fulfilling their mandates to guarantee a peaceful and levelled playing field in political contestation. The project focuses on three actors, namely the Office of the Registrar of Political Parties (ORPP), the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission's (IEBC) and the com-peting political parties. The intended support will focus primarily on three essential thematic areas: the electoral legal framework, particularly provisions for sound political finance, both democratic standards and gender equality in candidate nomination; and the overall electoral risk-management framework. The thematic areas identified for support under this proposal are consistent with the Electoral and Political Processes priorities outlined in the Kenya Vision 2030's political pillar. The 2030 Vision aims at enacting and operationalizing the necessary policy, legal and institutional framework to support the development of issue-based political processes through, inter alia:  the introduction of new laws and regulations covering politi-cal parties; the enhancement of the legal and regulatory framework covering the electoral process; and the strengthening of laws to promote the inclusion of women and other marginalized groups in the electoral process . The modalities of support proposed in the project's outputs and activities consist of providing comparative knowledge, creation of dialogue opportunities, strengthening organisational structures, operational capacities, modes of inter-institutional cooperation, and the legislative framework under which the ORPP, the IEBC and competing political parties operate.
